\"good\", \"fair\", \"poor\", or \"critical\"\n- **`temperature`**: (Required) Battery temperature status - \"normal\", \"warm\", \"hot\", or \"cool\"\n- **`last_updated`**: (Required) ISO 8601 timestamp\n\n**`STORAGE`**: (Optional) StorageInsight object containing:\n- **`total_gb`**: (Required) Total storage capacity in gigabytes (non-negative integer)\n- **`used_gb`**: (Required) Used storage space in gigabytes (non-negative integer)\n- **`available_gb`**: (Required) Available storage space in gigabytes (non-negative integer)\n- **`usage_breakdown`**: (Required) Object with storage usage by category:\n  - **`photos`**: (Required) GB used by photos\n  - **`apps`**: (Required) GB used by applications\n  - **`system`**: (Required) GB used by operating system\n  - **`other`**: (Required) GB used by other data\n- **`last_updated`**: (Required) ISO 8601 timestamp\n\n**`UNCATEGORIZED`**: (Optional) UncategorizedInsight object containing:\n- **`network_signal`**: (Required) Network quality descriptor - \"excellent\", \"good\", \"fair\", \"poor\", or \"none\"\n- **`wifi_strength`**: (Required) WiFi signal strength as integer percentage 0-100\n- **`cellular_signal`**: (Required) Cellular signal strength as integer 0-5 (bars)\n- **`memory_usage`**: (Required) RAM usage as integer percentage 0-100\n- **`cpu_usage`**: (Required) CPU usage as integer percentage 0-100\n- **`last_updated`**: (Required) ISO 8601 timestamp\n\n</details>\n\n</details>\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"read-tools\">\n<summary>Read-Only Tools</summary>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>open</summary>\n\nNavigates to a specific settings page within the device interface. This is a UI navigation action that doesn't modify device state but takes the user to the appropriate settings screen.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `setting_type` (optional): The setting page to open. Accepts any DeviceSettingType value as a case-insensitive string (e.g., \"WIFI\", \"wifi\", \"WiFi\" all work). If omitted or set to \"UNSPECIFIED\", opens the general device settings page. Valid values include: \"ACCESSIBILITY\", \"ACCOUNT\", \"AIRPLANE_MODE\", \"ALARM_VOLUME\", \"APPLICATION\", \"APP_DATA_USAGE\", \"AUTO_ROTATE\", \"BARD\", \"BATTERY\", \"BATTERY_SAVER\", \"BIOMETRIC\", \"BLUETOOTH\", \"BLUETOOTH_PAIRING\", \"BRIGHTNESS\", \"CALL_VOLUME\", \"CAST\", \"DARK_THEME\", \"DATA_SAVER\", \"DATE_TIME\", \"DEVELOPER_OPTION\", \"DEVICE_INFO\", \"DISPLAY\", \"DO_NOT_DISTURB\", \"GEMINI\", \"GOOGLE_ASSISTANT\", \"HOT_SPOT\", \"INTERNAL_STORAGE\", \"LANGUAGE\", \"LOCATION\", \"LOCK_SCREEN\", \"MEDIA_VOLUME\", \"NETWORK\", \"NFC\", \"NIGHT_MODE\", \"NOTIFICATION_VOLUME\", \"RING_VOLUME\", \"TALK_BACK\", \"VOLUME\", \"VIBRATION\", \"WIFI\", and \"UNSPECIFIED\".\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Navigate to general settings: `open()` or `open(setting_type=\"UNSPECIFIED\")`\n- Navigate to WiFi settings: `open(setting_type=\"WIFI\")`\n- Navigate to battery settings: `open(setting_type=\"BATTERY\")`\n- Navigate to volume settings: `open(setting_type=\"VOLUME\")`\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary containing result message (e.g., \"Opened wifi settings page.\") and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"open_settings\" and the setting type opened.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get</summary>\n\nRetrieves the current value of a device setting, returning either a percentage value, toggle state (on/off), or both depending on the setting type.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `setting_type` (required): The setting to retrieve. Must be one of the getable device settings. Case-insensitive string. Valid values: \"AIRPLANE_MODE\", \"ALARM_VOLUME\", \"AUTO_ROTATE\", \"BATTERY\", \"BATTERY_SAVER\", \"BLUETOOTH\", \"BRIGHTNESS\", \"CALL_VOLUME\", \"DO_NOT_DISTURB\", \"FLASHLIGHT\", \"HOT_SPOT\", \"MEDIA_VOLUME\", \"NETWORK\", \"NFC\", \"NIGHT_MODE\", \"NOTIFICATION_VOLUME\", \"RING_VOLUME\", \"TALK_BACK\", \"VOLUME\", \"VIBRATION\", \"WIFI\".\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Check WiFi status: `get(setting_type=\"WIFI\")` returns `{on_or_off: \"off\"}`\n- Check media volume: `get(setting_type=\"MEDIA_VOLUME\")` returns `{percentage_value: 60}`\n- Check if Bluetooth is on: `get(setting_type=\"BLUETOOTH\")` returns `{on_or_off: \"on\"}`\n- Check brightness level: `get(setting_type=\"BRIGHTNESS\")` returns `{percentage_value: 50}`\n\n**Returns:** SettingInfo object containing setting_type, optional percentage_value (0-100 for percentage-based settings), optional on_or_off (\"on\" or \"off\" for toggleable settings), card_id, and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"get_setting\".\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- **Battery** returns percentage_value under the \"percentage_value\" key of Device Settings, not the value stored in Device Insights\n- **WiFi returns only on_or_off state, not the additional WiFi-specific fields (available_networks, etc.)**\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>list_all_available_wifi</summary>\n\nLists all WiFi networks currently detected by the device, along with the currently connected network if any.\n\n**Parameters:** None\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- View available WiFi networks: `list_all_available_wifi()`\n\n**Returns:**\n- ActionSummary with result message listing available networks and current connection status.\n- *e.g. \"Available WiFi networks: HomeNetwork, OfficeWiFi, GuestNetwork (Currently connected to: HomeNetwork)\" or \"No WiFi networks are currently available.\" if none detected.*\n- Includes card_id and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"list_available_wifi\" and available_networks array.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_installed_apps</summary>\n\nRetrieves a list of all applications installed on the device, excluding their notification settings.\n\n**Parameters:** None\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Get list of installed apps: `get_installed_apps()`\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result containing array of app names (e.g., [\"Messages\", \"Mail\", \"Calendar\", \"Photos\", \"Settings\", \"Safari\", \"Camera\", \"Maps\", \"Weather\", \"App Store\"]). Includes card_id and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"get_installed_apps\".\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- Returns only app names, not their notification settings (use get_app_notification_status for that)\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_app_notification_status</summary>\n\nGets the current notification setting for a specific application.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `app_name` (required): Name of the app to query. Case-SENSITIVE - must match exactly as stored (e.g., \"Messages\" works, but \"messages\" or \"MESSAGES\" will fail).\n\n**Prerequisites:** The app must be installed on the device. Use get_installed_apps to verify app existence and see exact capitalization.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Check Messages notifications: `get_app_notification_status(app_name=\"Messages\")` returns \"on\"\n- Check Photos notifications: `get_app_notification_status(app_name=\"Photos\")` returns \"off\"\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result containing notification status (\"on\" or \"off\"). Includes card_id and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"get_app_notification_status\".\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- **IMPORTANT: App name matching is case-SENSITIVE (must match app name exactly as stored, e.g., \"Messages\" not \"messages\")**\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_device_insights</summary>\n\nGenerates device health and performance insights based on the current device state. Returns detailed information about battery, storage, or general system status.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `device_state_type` (optional): The category of insights to retrieve. Case-sensitive. Valid values: \"BATTERY\", \"STORAGE\", \"UNCATEGORIZED\". Defaults to \"UNCATEGORIZED\" (general system status).\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Get general insights: `get_device_insights()` or `get_device_insights(device_state_type=\"UNCATEGORIZED\")`\n- Get battery insights: `get_device_insights(device_state_type=\"BATTERY\")`\n- Get storage insights: `get_device_insights(device_state_type=\"STORAGE\")`\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result containing formatted insight strings. For example:\n- Battery: \"Percentage: 85 Charging status: not_charging Estimated time remaining: 8 hours Health: good Temperature: normal\"\n- Uncategorized: \"Network signal: excellent Wifi strength: 95 Cellular signal: 4 Memory usage: 65 Cpu usage: 12\"\n\nIncludes card_id and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"get_device_insights\" and insights array containing individual insight strings.\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- Each insight category (BATTERY, STORAGE, UNCATEGORIZED) maintains independent data and corresponds to the section of that name in the Device Insights collection of the DB.\n- Returns \"Device is operating normally.\" if no insights are available\n\n</details>\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"write-tools\">\n<summary>State-Changing Tools</summary>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>on</summary>\n\nTurns on a toggleable device setting.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `setting` (required): The setting to turn on. Case-insensitive string. Valid values: \"AIRPLANE_MODE\", \"AUTO_ROTATE\", \"BATTERY_SAVER\", \"BLUETOOTH\", \"DO_NOT_DISTURB\", \"FLASHLIGHT\", \"HOT_SPOT\", \"NETWORK\", \"NFC\", \"NIGHT_MODE\", \"TALK_BACK\", \"VIBRATION\", \"WIFI\".\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Turn on WiFi: `on(setting=\"WIFI\")`\n- Enable Bluetooth: `on(setting=\"BLUETOOTH\")`\n- Activate Do Not Disturb: `on(setting=\"DO_NOT_DISTURB\")`\n\n**State Changes:** Sets the on_or_off field to \"on\" for the specified setting in the device_settings.settings object. Updates the last_updated timestamp.\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result message (e.g., \"Turned on wifi.\"), card_id, and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"toggle_setting\", the setting name, and state \"on\".\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- Turning on an already-on setting will not throw an error\n- Cannot toggle non-toggleable settings: BATTERY and BRIGHTNESS are read-only (no API methods to modify them); volume settings use dedicated volume functions (set_volume, adjust_volume, mute, unmute)\n- **Turning on WiFi replaces the entire WiFi state with only `{on_or_off: \"on\"}`, removing all WiFi-specific fields. This means previously saved networks, available networks, and connected network data are lost when WiFi is turned on**\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>off</summary>\n\nTurns off a toggleable device setting.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `setting` (required): The setting to turn off. Case-insensitive string. Valid values: \"AIRPLANE_MODE\", \"AUTO_ROTATE\", \"BATTERY_SAVER\", \"BLUETOOTH\", \"DO_NOT_DISTURB\", \"FLASHLIGHT\", \"HOT_SPOT\", \"NETWORK\", \"NFC\", \"NIGHT_MODE\", \"TALK_BACK\", \"VIBRATION\", \"WIFI\".\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Deactivate Do Not Disturb: `off(setting=\"DO_NOT_DISTURB\")`\n- Disable flashlight: `off(setting=\"FLASHLIGHT\")`\n- Turn off airplane mode: `off(setting=\"AIRPLANE_MODE\")`\n\n**State Changes:** Sets the on_or_off field to \"off\" for the specified setting in the device_settings.settings object. Updates the last_updated timestamp.\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result message (e.g., \"Turned off bluetooth.\"), card_id, and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"toggle_setting\", the setting name, and state \"off\".\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- Turning off an already-off setting will not throw an error\n- Cannot toggle non-toggleable settings: BATTERY and BRIGHTNESS are read-only (no API methods to modify them); volume settings use dedicated volume functions (set_volume, adjust_volume, mute, unmute)\n- **Turning off WiFi replaces the entire WiFi state with only `{on_or_off: \"off\"}`, removing all WiFi-specific fields (connected_network, available_networks, saved_networks). This effectively disconnects from any connected network and clears all WiFi data**\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>set_volume</summary>\n\nSets one or more volume levels to a specific percentage value.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `to` (required): Target volume level as integer 0-100. Values outside this range raise ValueError.\n\u2022 `setting` (optional): Specific volume type to set. Case-insensitive string. Valid values: \"ALARM\", \"CALL\", \"MEDIA\", \"NOTIFICATION\", \"RING\", \"UNSPECIFIED\". If omitted or \"UNSPECIFIED\", sets all volume types to the specified level.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Set all volumes to 50%: `set_volume(to=50)` or `set_volume(to=50, setting=\"UNSPECIFIED\")`\n- Set media volume to 75%: `set_volume(to=75, setting=\"MEDIA\")`\n- Set call volume to 60%: `set_volume(to=60, setting=\"CALL\")`\n\n**State Changes:** Updates percentage_value for the specified volume type(s) in device_settings.settings. Updates last_updated timestamps.\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result message (e.g., \"Set media volume to 75%.\"), card_id, and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"set_volume\", setting type, and volume level.\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- Setting to 0 effectively mutes without using the mute function\n- Volume types map to database keys: ALARM\u2192ALARM_VOLUME, CALL\u2192CALL_VOLUME, MEDIA\u2192MEDIA_VOLUME, NOTIFICATION\u2192NOTIFICATION_VOLUME, RING\u2192RING_VOLUME\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>adjust_volume</summary>\n\nAdjusts one or more volume levels by a relative amount (increase or decrease).\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `by` (required): Amount to adjust in percentage points. Can be positive (increase) or negative (decrease). Integer value. Results are clamped to 0-100 range.\n\u2022 `setting` (optional): Specific volume type to adjust. Case-insensitive string. Valid values: \"ALARM\", \"CALL\", \"MEDIA\", \"NOTIFICATION\", \"RING\", \"UNSPECIFIED\". If omitted or \"UNSPECIFIED\", adjusts all volume types.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Increase all volumes by 10%: `adjust_volume(by=10)`\n- Decrease media volume by 20%: `adjust_volume(by=-20, setting=\"MEDIA\")`\n- Increase ring volume by 5%: `adjust_volume(by=5, setting=\"RING\")`\n- Decrease all volumes by 15%: `adjust_volume(by=-15, setting=\"UNSPECIFIED\")`\n\n**State Changes:** Adds the specified amount to the current percentage_value for the target volume type(s). Updates last_updated timestamps.\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result message (e.g., \"Adjusted media volume by -20%.\"), card_id, and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"adjust_volume\", setting type, and adjustment amount.\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- Adjusting beyond boundaries stops at 0 or 100 rather than wrapping or erroring (e.g., adjusting 95% by +10 results in 100%, not 105%)\n- If a volume type has no current value in the database, assumes 65% as the starting point before applying the adjustment\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>mute</summary>\n\nMutes (sets to 0%) one or more volume types.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `setting` (optional): Specific volume type to mute. Case-insensitive string. Valid values: \"ALARM\", \"CALL\", \"MEDIA\", \"NOTIFICATION\", \"RING\", \"VOLUME\", \"UNSPECIFIED\". If omitted or \"UNSPECIFIED\", mutes all volume types.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Mute all volumes: `mute()` or `mute(setting=\"UNSPECIFIED\")`\n- Mute only media: `mute(setting=\"MEDIA\")`\n- Mute ring and call: requires two separate calls - `mute(setting=\"RING\")` and `mute(setting=\"CALL\")`\n\n**State Changes:** Sets percentage_value to 0 for the specified volume type(s). When muting all (UNSPECIFIED), affects ALARM_VOLUME, CALL_VOLUME, MEDIA_VOLUME, NOTIFICATION_VOLUME, RING_VOLUME, and VOLUME. Updates last_updated timestamps.\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result message (e.g., \"Muted media volume.\"), card_id, and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"mute_volume\" and setting type.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>unmute</summary>\n\nUnmutes one or more volume types. Restores to default levels, not to the previous volume before muting.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `setting` (optional): Specific volume type to unmute. Case-insensitive string. Valid values: \"ALARM\", \"CALL\", \"MEDIA\", \"NOTIFICATION\", \"RING\", \"UNSPECIFIED\". If omitted or \"UNSPECIFIED\", unmutes all volume types. Note: \"VOLUME\" setting type is NOT valid for unmute (unlike mute).\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Unmute all volumes to defaults: `unmute()` or `unmute(setting=\"UNSPECIFIED\")`\n- Unmute media to 60%: `unmute(setting=\"MEDIA\")`\n- Unmute alarm to 50%: `unmute(setting=\"ALARM\")`\n\n**State Changes:** Sets percentage_value to predefined default levels: ALARM_VOLUME=50, CALL_VOLUME=70, MEDIA_VOLUME=60, NOTIFICATION_VOLUME=40, RING_VOLUME=80, VOLUME=65. Updates last_updated timestamps.\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result message (e.g., \"Unmuted media volume.\"), card_id, and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"unmute_volume\" and setting type.\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- Unmuting an already-unmuted volume overwrites current value with default\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>connect_wifi</summary>\n\nConnects the device to a specific WiFi network. Turns WiFi on if off.\n\n**WARNING:** Do not call `on` or `off` for WiFi setting prior to calling this tool, as these will wipe all available networks from the database.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `network_name` (required): Name of the WiFi network to connect to. Must be present in the available_networks list. **Case-sensitive** string.\n\n**Prerequisites:** The target network must be in the `available_networks` list. Use `list_all_available_wifi` to see available networks.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Connect to home network: `connect_wifi(network_name=\"HomeNetwork\")`\n- Connect to office WiFi: `connect_wifi(network_name=\"OfficeWiFi-5G\")`\n\n**State Changes:**\n- If WiFi is off, automatically turns it on.\n- Adds the network to saved_networks if not already present.\n- Updates last_updated timestamp.\n\n**Returns:** \n- ActionSummary with result message. *e.g. Success: \"Successfully connected to WiFi network 'HomeNetwork'.\" Failure: \"Cannot connect to 'NonExistentNetwork'. Network not found in available networks: ['Network1', 'Network2']\".*\n- Includes card_id and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"connect_wifi\", network_name, and connected_network (null if failed).\n\n**Behavior Notes:**\n- Automatically turns WiFi on if it's currently off\n- Successfully connecting saves the network for future use\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>set_app_notification_status</summary>\n\nEnables or disables notifications for a specific installed application.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `app_name` (required): Name of the app to modify. Case-insensitive string (e.g., \"Messages\", \"messages\", \"MESSAGES\" all work).\n\u2022 `notifications` (required): Desired notification state. Must be \"on\" or \"off\" (case-insensitive).\n\n**Prerequisites:** The app must be installed on the device. Use `get_installed_apps` to verify.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Enable Messages notifications: `set_app_notification_status(app_name=\"Messages\", notifications=\"on\")`\n- Case-insensitive usage: `set_app_notification_status(app_name=\"calendar\", notifications=\"OFF\")`\n\n**State Changes:** Updates the notifications.value field for the specified app in the installed_apps.apps object. Updates the notifications.last_updated timestamp. If the app is not installed, no changes occur and an error is returned.\n\n**Returns:** ActionSummary with result message (e.g., \"Set notification status for 'Messages' to 'on'.\"), card_id, and action_card_content_passthrough with action type \"set_app_notification_status\".\n\n</details>\n\n</details>\n<br>\n  </details>\n      \n  <details>\n  <summary style=\"font-size: 24; font-weight: bold; color: slateblue;\">Hubspot</summary>\n  <style>\ndetails summary {\n    padding: 8px;\n    border-radius: 4px;\n    margin: 4px 0;\n    cursor: pointer;\n    font-weight: bold;\n}\ndetails[open] {\n    border: 1px solid #ddd;\n    border-radius: 4px;\n    padding: 8px;\n    margin: 8px 0;\n}\ndetails details {\n    margin-left: 16px;\n    border-left: 2px solid #ddd;\n    padding-left: 8px;\n}\n.overview { background-color: #d8eeffff; }\n.documentation { background-color: #fbe9ffff; }\n.data-structure { background-color: #fbefffff; border-left: 3px solid #6c757d; }\n.read-tools { background-color: #dcffe0ff; }\n.write-tools { background-color: #ffe8c2ff; }\n.tool { background-color: #f8f9fa; border-left: 3px solid #6c757d; }\n</style>\n\n<details class=\"overview\">\n<summary>\ud83d\udd0d Service Overview</summary>\n\nThe HubSpot Marketing service provides marketing automations including email templates, campaigns, forms, marketing events, and email sending. It supports both transactional and marketing email workflows.\n\n**Key Features:**\n- **Email Templates**: Create and manage reusable email templates with variable substitution for personalization\n- **Campaigns**: Organize marketing efforts with campaigns that include dates, budgets, and target audiences\n- **Forms**: Build marketing forms with customizable fields for lead capture\n- **Marketing Events**: Manage events with attendee tracking, registration, and custom properties\n- **Events & Attendees**: Track simple events and link them to contacts through attendee records\n- **Email Sending**: Send both transactional emails (order confirmations, password resets) and templated marketing emails\n- **Form Subscriptions**: Set up webhook subscriptions to get alerts for form events\n\n**High-Level Usage Patterns:**\n- Create email templates with personalization tokens like `{{contact.firstname}}`\n- Build campaigns to organize related marketing activities with start/end dates and budgets\n- Design forms for lead capture with simple field lists\n- Track marketing events with attendee management and registration status\n- Link contacts to events using the events and attendees collections\n- Send transactional emails for system notifications or templated marketing emails for campaigns\n\n**Default Example DB Overview:**\nThe default database contains 5 email templates, 5 campaigns, 5 forms, 5 marketing events, 5 simple events, 5 marketing emails, 5 transactional emails, 5 contacts, 11 attendee records, 5 subscription definitions, and 9 subscription entries.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"documentation\">\n<summary>\ud83d\udcda Detailed Documentation</summary>\n\n## Core Concepts\n\n### Email Templates\nEmail templates are reusable HTML or text email content with substitutions for personalization. Templates support:\n- **Personalization tokens** in the format `{{contact.property}}` (e.g., `{{contact.firstname}}`, `{{contact.email}}`)\n- **Template types** for different use cases (email, page, error page, subscription preferences)\n- **Category organization** (Unmapped, Landing Pages, Email, Blog Post, Site Page)\n- **Versioning** to track template changes over time\n- **Soft deletion** where templates can be marked as deleted but restored later\n\n### Campaigns\nCampaigns organize marketing activities and track:\n- **Time-based scheduling** with start and end dates\n- **Budget tracking** for campaign spend\n- **Target audience segmentation** (All Contacts, Leads, Specific Segment, Existing Customers)\n- **UTM parameters** for tracking campaign performance\n- **Status tracking** (PLANNED, IN_PROGRESS, COMPLETED, CANCELED)\n\n**IMPORTAN (bug):** Campaigns can only be edited with `update_campaign` if they have all of `start_year`, `start_month`, `start_day`, `end_year`, `end_month`, and `end_day` fields. Make sure all of these are present for any campaign you want to modify!\n\n### Marketing Events\nEvents track webinars, conferences, trade shows, and workshops:\n- **External system integration** using externalEventId and externalAccountId for syncing with external platforms\n- **Attendee management** with registration, attendance, and no-show tracking (distinct from standard event and attendee tracking)\n- **Custom properties** for flexible event metadata\n- **Time tracking** with start and end dates/times\n- **Organizer and URL information** for event details\n\n### Forms\nMarketing forms collect lead information with:\n- **Field groups** containing structured field definitions with types, labels, validation rules, and options\n- **Submit button customization** with configurable text\n- **Redirect URLs** for post-submission navigation\n- **Legal consent options** for GDPR compliance including explicit consent, implicit consent, and legitimate interest configurations\n- **Timestamps** tracking creation and updates\n\n### Events and Attendees\nSimple event tracking system separate from marketing events:\n- **Events** are basic records with name and start/end times\n- **Attendees** link contacts to events with registration tracking\n- **Status tracking** for attendance (Attended, Registered, No-show, Cancelled)\n\n### Transactional vs Marketing Emails\n- **Transactional emails** are system-triggered (order confirmations, password resets, account verification) sent to individual recipients with custom properties\n- **Marketing emails** are promotional campaigns sent to audiences with features like discount codes, launch dates, reward points, and access codes\n\n### Form Subscriptions\nForm subscriptions are webhook configurations that send notifications to external systems when specific form-related actions happen. Form events include things like when someone submits a form, when a form is created or modified, or when a form is deleted. The subscription system allows you to:\n- **Set up webhook endpoints** to receive real-time notifications when these form actions occur\n- **Choose event types** using subscription definitions (e.g., subscribe only to form submissions, or to all form changes)\n- **Create active subscriptions** that link your webhook URLs to the specific event types you want to monitor\n- **Receive event payloads** containing the form data and metadata at your webhook endpoint\n- **Manage subscriptions** by creating, viewing, and deleting webhook configurations as your needs change\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>Database Structure</summary>\n\nThe HubSpot database has multiple root collections storing different types of marketing data:\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>templates</summary>\n\nCollection of email templates keyed by numeric template ID (e.g., `296483214`). Each template stores reusable content with personalization variables.\n\n**Template Object:**\n\n**`id`**: (Required) Unique numeric identifier for the template (e.g., `296483214`).\n\n**`source`**: (Required) The template content/source code with optional personalization tokens like `{{contact.firstname}}`.\n\n**`template_type`**: (Required) Integer indicating template type. Valid values: `2` (Email), `4` (Page), `11` (Error), `12` (Subscription preferences), `13` (Backup unsubscribe), `14` (Subscriptions update confirmation), `19` (Password prompt), `27` (Search results), `29` (Membership login), `30` (Membership registration), `31` (Membership reset password confirmation), `32` (Membership reset password request). Defaults to `2`.\n\n**`category_id`**: (Required) Integer for category classification. Valid values: `0` (Unmapped), `1` (Landing Pages), `2` (Email), `3` (Blog Post), `4` (Site Page). Defaults to `2`.\n\n**`folder`**: (Optional) Folder path where template is saved (e.g., `/templates/`). Can be `null`.\n\n**`path`**: (Optional) Full path to template in Design Manager (e.g., `/home/templates/`). Can be `null`.\n\n**`created`**: (Required) Timestamp in milliseconds since epoch as string (e.g., `\"1743414779084\"`).\n\n**`deleted_at`**: (Optional) Timestamp in milliseconds since epoch as string. `null` if not deleted.\n\n**`is_available_for_new_content`**: (Required) Boolean indicating if template can be used for new content. Defaults to `false`.\n\n**`archived`**: (Required) Boolean indicating archived status. Defaults to `false`.\n\n**`versions`**: (Optional) Array of template versions. Each version contains:\n- `source`: (Required) The source code for this version\n- `version_id`: (Required) Version identifier string (e.g., `1`, `2`)\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>campaigns</summary>\n\nCollection of marketing campaigns keyed by UUID (e.g., `35110ef2-819b-40de-a972-1f4161e24649`). Campaigns organize marketing activities with scheduling and targeting.\n\n**Campaign Object:**\n\n**`campaign_id`**: (Required) UUID identifier for the campaign.\n\n**`campaign_name`**: (Required) Display name for the campaign (e.g., `Spring 2024 Promotion`).\n\n**`start_date`**: (Optional) Campaign start date in ISO 8601 format (e.g., `2024-01-20T18:38:18`). Present in default DB campaigns.\n\n**`end_date`**: (Optional) Campaign end date in ISO 8601 format (e.g., `2024-11-02T12:20:32`). Present in default DB campaigns.\n\n**`start_year`**: (Optional) Start year as integer (e.g., `2024`). Required for update_campaign to work.\n\n**`start_month`**: (Optional) Start month as integer 1-12 (e.g., `3` for March). Required for update_campaign to work.\n\n**`start_day`**: (Optional) Start day as integer 1-31 (e.g., `15`). Required for update_campaign to work.\n\n**`end_year`**: (Optional) End year as integer (e.g., `2024`). Required for update_campaign to work.\n\n**`end_month`**: (Optional) End month as integer 1-12 (e.g., `11` for November). Required for update_campaign to work.\n\n**`end_day`**: (Optional) End day as integer 1-31 (e.g., `2`). Required for update_campaign to work.\n\n**`status`**: (Required) Campaign status string - one of: `PLANNED`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `COMPLETED`, `CANCELED`.\n\n**`budget`**: (Required) Budget amount as number (e.g., `1438.53`, `8644.86`).\n\n**`target_audience`**: (Required) Target audience description (e.g., `All Contacts`, `Leads`, `Existing Customers`, `Specific Segment`).\n\n**`utm_campaign`**: (Required) UTM campaign parameter for tracking (e.g., `spring_2024_promotion`).\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>forms</summary>\n\nCollection of marketing forms keyed by UUID (e.g., `d3c547d5-d7ca-4a82-ac45-a82bcb3f4f32`). Forms collect lead information with customizable fields.\n\n**Form Object:**\n\n**`form_id`**: (Required) UUID identifier for the form.\n\n**`form_name`**: (Required) Display name for the form (e.g., `Contact Us`, `Newsletter Subscription`).\n\n**`fields`**: (Required) Array of field names included in the form (e.g., `[\"first_name\", \"last_name\", \"email\", \"phone_number\", \"job_title\", \"company\"]`).\n\n**`submit_text`**: (Required) Text displayed on the submit button (e.g., `Submit Contact Us`, `Sign Up Now`).\n\n**`redirect_url`**: (Required) URL to redirect to after form submission (e.g., `thank-you-1`).\n\n**`created_at`**: (Required) ISO 8601 timestamp of creation (e.g., `2023-05-22T15:12:35`).\n\n**`updated_at`**: (Required) ISO 8601 timestamp of last update (e.g., `2024-04-24T02:18:41`).\n\n**`legalConsentOptions`**: (Optional) Legal consent configuration for GDPR compliance. Can be `null`. When present, contains:\n- `explicitConsentToProcess` (optional): Explicit consent configuration with:\n  - `communicationsCheckboxes` (array): Checkbox configurations with `subscriptionTypeId`, `label`, and `required` fields\n  - `communicationConsentText` (string): Text explaining communication consent\n  - `consentToProcessCheckboxLabel` (string): Label for consent checkbox\n  - `consentToProcessFooterText` (string): Footer text for consent\n  - `type` (string): Consent type identifier\n  - `privacyText` (string): Privacy policy text\n  - `consentToProcessText` (string): Text explaining consent to process data\n- `implicitConsentToProcess` (optional): Implicit consent configuration with similar structure to explicit consent\n- `legitimateInterest` (optional): Legitimate interest configuration with `lawfulBasis`, `type`, and `privacyText` fields\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>marketing_events</summary>\n\nCollection of marketing events keyed by externalEventId (e.g., `gads-456-7890`, `sf-0015g00000XyzAbCdE`). Events track webinars, conferences, and other marketing activities.\n\n**Marketing Event Object:**\n\n**`externalEventId`**: (Required) Unique identifier from external system (e.g., `gads-456-7890`).\n\n**`externalAccountId`**: (Required) Account identifier from external system (e.g., `123-456-7890`).\n\n**`eventName`**: (Required) Display name for the event (e.g., `CES 2024`, `Web Development with React`).\n\n**`eventType`**: (Required) Type of event (e.g., `Trade Show`, `Webinar`, `Conference`, `Workshop`, `Online Course`, `Symposium`).\n\n**`eventOrganizer`**: (Required) Organizer name (e.g., `Acme Corp`).\n\n**`startDateTime`**: (Required) Event start in ISO 8601 format (e.g., `2024-02-03T20:21:10`).\n\n**`endDateTime`**: (Required) Event end in ISO 8601 format (e.g., `2024-04-09T11:48:26`).\n\n**`eventDescription`**: (Required) Detailed description of the event.\n\n**`eventUrl`**: (Required) URL for more information or registration.\n\n**`customProperties`**: (Optional) Object containing custom metadata as key-value pairs (e.g., `{\"location\": \"Online\"}`).\n\n**`attendees`**: (Required) Object containing nested attendee records keyed by attendeeId (8-character hash), or empty object `{}` if no attendees. Each attendee contains:\n  - `attendeeId` (string): Hash-based identifier\n  - `email` (string): Attendee's email address\n  - `eventId` (string): External event ID\n  - `externalAccountId` (string): External account ID\n  - `joinedAt` (optional string): ISO 8601 timestamp when attendee joined\n  - `leftAt` (optional string): ISO 8601 timestamp when attendee left\n\n**`registrants`**: (Optional) Integer count of registrations. Present only in events created via API.\n\n**`noShows`**: (Optional) Integer count of no-shows. Present only in events created via API.\n\n**`cancellations`**: (Optional) Integer count of cancellations. Present only in events created via API.\n\n**`eventCancelled`**: (Optional) Boolean indicating if the event was cancelled. Present only in events created via API (initialized to `False`).\n\n**`id`**: (Optional) Internal UUID. Present only in events created via API (auto-generated, different from externalEventId).\n\n**`objectId`**: (Optional) Object identifier UUID. Present only in events created via API (auto-generated).\n\n**`createdAt`**: (Optional) ISO 8601 timestamp. Present only in events created via API (auto-generated).\n\n**`updatedAt`**: (Optional) ISO 8601 timestamp. Present only in events created via API (auto-generated and updated on modifications).\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>marketing_emails</summary>\n\nCollection of marketing emails keyed by UUID (e.g., `ccf9d6ad-dd24-42c3-8592-f5e2688b36b2`). Marketing emails are promotional messages with special fields.\n\n**Marketing Email Object:**\n\n**`name`**: (Required) Internal name of the email (e.g., `Exclusive Offer Inside!`).\n\n**`subject`**: (Optional) Email subject line.\n\n**`htmlBody`**: (Optional) HTML content of the email body.\n\n**`isTransactional`**: (Optional) Boolean indicating if this is transactional. Defaults to `false`.\n\n**`status`**: (Optional) Email status (e.g., `scheduled`, `sent`, `draft`).\n\n**`discount_code`**: (Optional) Discount code for promotional emails (e.g., `SAVE20`).\n\n**`expiration`**: (Optional) Expiration date in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., `2025-03-31`).\n\n**`launch_date`**: (Optional) Launch date for product announcements in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., `2025-04-15`).\n\n**`sale_end_date`**: (Optional) End date for sales promotions in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., `2025-03-25`).\n\n**`reward_points`**: (Optional) Integer number of reward points for loyalty programs (e.g., `500`).\n\n**`access_code`**: (Optional) Access code for VIP or exclusive offers (e.g., `VIP2025`).\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>transactional_emails</summary>\n\nCollection of transactional emails keyed by UUID. Each key maps to an array containing email objects. Transactional emails are system-triggered communications.\n\n**Transactional Email Object (array item):**\n\n**`emailId`**: (Required) UUID identifier for the email.\n\n**`message`**: (Required) Message object containing:\n- `to`: (Required) Recipient email address (e.g., `customer1@gmail.com`)\n- `from`: (Required) Sender email address (e.g., `support@gmail.com`)\n- `subject`: (Required) Email subject line (e.g., `Order Confirmation`)\n- `htmlBody`: (Required) HTML content of the email (e.g., `<p>Thank you for your order!</p>`)\n- `cc`: (Optional) Array of CC email addresses\n- `bcc`: (Optional) Array of BCC email addresses\n- `replyTo`: (Optional) Reply-to email address\n\n**`customProperties`**: (Optional) Object with custom key-value pairs for personalization (e.g., `{\"order_id\": 12345, \"priority\": \"high\"}`).\n\n**`status`**: (Optional) Email status (e.g., `sent`, `pending`, `scheduled`).\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>events</summary>\n\nCollection of simple events keyed by UUID (e.g., `efb8c2ce-2ae8-4e93-96e8-353cd421b3a9`). These are basic event records used by attendees. For full-featured marketing events, see the `marketing_events` collection.\n\n**Event Object:**\n\n**`event_id`**: (Required) UUID identifier for the event.\n\n**`event_name`**: (Required) Display name for the event (e.g., `Salesforce Training`).\n\n**`start_time`**: (Required) Event start time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., `2024-02-07T15:50:41`).\n\n**`end_time`**: (Required) Event end time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., `2024-10-15T20:08:12`).\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>attendees</summary>\n\nCollection of event attendees keyed by UUID (e.g., `f45e808f-889a-423d-b8c2-e2628ec56065`). Links contacts to simple events with registration tracking.\n\n**Important:** This collection is for simple `events`, NOT `marketing_events`. Marketing events have their own nested attendee structure (see marketing_events documentation above).\n\n**Attendee Object:**\n\n**`attendee_id`**: (Required) UUID identifier for the attendee record.\n\n**`event_id`**: (Required) UUID of the event from the `events` collection.\n\n**`contact_id`**: (Required) UUID of the contact from the `contacts` collection.\n\n**`registration_date`**: (Required) ISO 8601 timestamp of registration (e.g., `2023-12-31T09:07:29`).\n\n**`status`**: (Required) Attendee status - one of: `Attended`, `Registered`, `No-show`, `Cancelled`.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>contacts</summary>\n\nCollection of contacts keyed by UUID (e.g., `cf9e6433-d272-4370-b30e-1b29d68f923b`). Contacts represent leads and customers.\n\n**Contact Object:**\n\n**`contact_id`**: (Required) UUID identifier for the contact.\n\n**`first_name`**: (Required) Contact's first name (e.g., `Frank`).\n\n**`last_name`**: (Required) Contact's last name (e.g., `Anderson`).\n\n**`email`**: (Required) Contact's email address (e.g., `frank.anderson@gmail.com`).\n\n**`phone_number`**: (Optional) Phone number with country code (e.g., `+1-503-901-3228`).\n\n**`job_title`**: (Optional) Job title (e.g., `Business Analyst`, `Marketing Manager`).\n\n**`company`**: (Optional) Company name (e.g., `Oscorp`, `Acme Corp`).\n\n**`created_at`**: (Required) ISO 8601 timestamp of creation.\n\n**`updated_at`**: (Required) ISO 8601 timestamp of last update.\n\n**`lifecycle_stage`**: (Required) Stage in customer lifecycle - one of: `subscriber`, `lead`, `marketingqualifiedlead`, `salesqualifiedlead`, `opportunity`, `customer`, `evangelist`, `other`.\n\n**`lead_status`**: (Required) Lead status - one of: `NEW`, `OPEN`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `OPEN_DEAL`, `UNQUALIFIED`, `ATTEMPTED_TO_CONTACT`, `CONNECTED`, `BAD_TIMING`.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>subscription_definitions</summary>\n\nArray of subscription type definitions. These define available subscription types for form webhooks.\n\n**Subscription Definition Object:**\n\n**`subscription_id`**: (Required) UUID identifier for the subscription type.\n\n**`name`**: (Required) Display name (e.g., `Newsletter`, `Product Updates`).\n\n**`description`**: (Required) Description of what the subscription provides (e.g., `Receive Daily updates about Newsletter`).\n\n**`frequency`**: (Required) Update frequency (e.g., `Daily`, `Weekly`, `Monthly`, `Quarterly`).\n\n**`active`**: (Required) Boolean indicating if subscription type is active.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"data-structure\">\n<summary>subscriptions</summary>\n\nCollection of active subscriptions keyed by subscription ID. Each subscription represents a webhook endpoint configuration.\n\n**Subscription Object:**\n\n**`id`**: (Required) Subscription identifier (UUID).\n\n**`endpoint`**: (Optional) Webhook endpoint URL. Can be `null`.\n\n**`subscriptionDetails`**: (Required) Object containing:\n- `contact_id`: (Optional) Associated contact UUID\n- `registration_date`: (Optional) ISO 8601 timestamp of registration\n- `status`: (Optional) Status string (e.g., \"No-show\", \"Registered\", \"Attended\")\n\n**`active`**: (Optional) Boolean indicating if subscription is active (defaults to `true` when not specified).\n\n**Nested Attendee Objects**: Subscriptions may also contain nested attendee objects keyed by attendee UUID. Each attendee object contains `attendee_id`, `event_id`, `contact_id`, `registration_date`, and `status`.\n\n</details>\n\n</details>\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"read-tools\">\n<summary>\ud83d\udcd6 Read-Only Tools</summary>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_templates</summary>\n\nRetrieves a list of email templates with optional pagination and filtering.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum number of templates to return. Defaults to 20\n\u2022 `offset` (optional): Number of templates to skip for pagination. Defaults to 0\n\u2022 `deleted_at` (optional): Filter by deletion timestamp in milliseconds since epoch\n\u2022 `id` (optional): Filter by specific template ID\n\u2022 `is_available_for_new_content` (optional): Filter by availability for new content\n\u2022 `label` (optional): Filter by template label\n\u2022 `path` (optional): Filter by template path\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- List first 10 templates: `limit=10`\n- Get templates from offset 20: `offset=20, limit=10`\n- Find non-deleted templates: No `deleted_at` filter\n- Get specific template: `id=\"296483214\"`\n\n**Returns:** Array of template objects.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_template_by_id</summary>\n\nRetrieves a specific email template by its numeric ID.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `template_id` (required): Unique numeric identifier for the template (e.g., `296483214`)\n\n**Prerequisites:** The template ID can be obtained from `get_templates` or conversation context.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Get specific template: `template_id=\"296483214\"`\n- Check template content before using: Retrieve to view source and personalization tokens\n\n**Returns:** Single template object.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_campaigns</summary>\n\nReturns a list of marketing campaigns with optional filtering and pagination.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum number of campaigns to return\n\u2022 `offset` (optional): Number of campaigns to skip\n\u2022 `created_at` (optional): Filter by exact creation date\n\u2022 `created_at__gt` (optional): Filter campaigns created after this date\n\u2022 `created_at__gte` (optional): Filter campaigns created on or after this date\n\u2022 `created_at__lt` (optional): Filter campaigns created before this date\n\u2022 `created_at__lte` (optional): Filter campaigns created on or before this date\n\u2022 `updated_at` (optional): Filter by exact update date\n\u2022 `updated_at__gt` (optional): Filter campaigns updated after this date\n\u2022 `updated_at__gte` (optional): Filter campaigns updated on or after this date\n\u2022 `updated_at__lt` (optional): Filter campaigns updated before this date\n\u2022 `updated_at__lte` (optional): Filter campaigns updated on or before this date\n\u2022 `name` (optional): Filter by exact campaign name\n\u2022 `name__contains` (optional): Filter campaigns with name containing string\n\u2022 `name__icontains` (optional): Filter campaigns with name containing string (case insensitive)\n\u2022 `name__ne` (optional): Filter campaigns with name not equal to string\n\u2022 `id` (optional): Filter by campaign ID\n\u2022 `id__ne` (optional): Filter campaigns with ID not equal to string\n\u2022 `type` (optional): Filter by campaign type\n\u2022 `type__ne` (optional): Filter campaigns with type not equal to string\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- List all campaigns: No parameters\n- Get first 5 campaigns: `limit=5`\n- Find campaigns by name: `name__icontains=\"spring\"`\n- Get campaigns after date: `created_at__gt=\"2024-01-01T00:00:00\"`\n\n**Returns:** Object with `results` array containing campaign objects, plus pagination fields `total`, `limit`, and `offset`.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_campaign_by_id</summary>\n\nGets a single campaign by its UUID identifier.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `campaign_id` (required): UUID of the campaign\n\n**Prerequisites:** Campaign ID can be obtained from `get_campaigns`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Get specific campaign: `campaign_id=\"35110ef2-819b-40de-a972-1f4161e24649\"`\n- View campaign details before updating: Retrieve to check current values\n\n**Returns:** Single campaign object.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_forms</summary>\n\nRetrieves marketing forms with options for filtering.\n\n**BUG - cannot handle pagination! Do not use `after` or `limit` parameters, or set the per-page limit higher than the number of matching results.**\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `after` (optional): Form ID to start after for pagination\n\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum number of forms to return per page\n\u2022 `created_at` (optional): Filter by exact creation date (ISO 8601 format)\n\u2022 `created_at__gt` (optional): Filter forms created after date\n\u2022 `created_at__gte` (optional): Filter forms created on or after date\n\u2022 `created_at__lt` (optional): Filter forms created before date\n\u2022 `created_at__lte` (optional): Filter forms created on or before date\n\u2022 `updated_at` (optional): Filter by exact update date (ISO 8601 format)\n\u2022 `updated_at__gt` (optional): Filter forms updated after date\n\u2022 `updated_at__gte` (optional): Filter forms updated on or after date\n\u2022 `updated_at__lt` (optional): Filter forms updated before date\n\u2022 `updated_at__lte` (optional): Filter forms updated on or before date\n\u2022 `name` (optional): Filter by exact form name\n\u2022 `id` (optional): Filter by exact form ID\n\u2022 `archived` (optional): Filter by archived status\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- List all forms: No parameters\n- Get forms created in 2024: `created_at__gte=\"2024-01-01T00:00:00\"`\n- Find form by name: `name=\"Contact Us\"`\n\n**Returns:** Array of form objects.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_form_by_id</summary>\n\nGet a specific marketing form by its UUID.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `formId` (required): UUID of the form\n\n**Prerequisites:** Form ID can be obtained from `get_forms`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Get specific form: `formId=\"d3c547d5-d7ca-4a82-ac45-a82bcb3f4f32\"`\n- View form structure before updating: Retrieve to see current field configuration\n\n**Returns:** Single form object.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_marketing_events</summary>\n\nGet all marketing events with optional time-based filtering and pagination.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `occurredAfter` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp to filter events after this time\n\u2022 `occurredBefore` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp to filter events before this time\n\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum number of events to return (1-100). Defaults to 10\n\u2022 `after` (optional): Cursor for pagination to fetch next set of results\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- List all events: No parameters\n- Get recent events: `occurredAfter=\"2024-01-01T00:00:00\"`\n- Limit results: `limit=5`\n- Filter by date range: `occurredAfter=\"2024-01-01T00:00:00\", occurredBefore=\"2024-12-31T23:59:59\"`\n\n**Returns:** Array of marketing event objects.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_marketing_event_by_id</summary>\n\nGet a specific marketing event by its external identifiers.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Unique identifier from the external system where event was created\n\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from the external system\n\n**Prerequisites:** Both externalEventId and externalAccountId can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Get Google Ads event: `externalEventId=\"gads-456-7890\", externalAccountId=\"123-456-7890\"`\n- Get Salesforce event: `externalEventId=\"sf-0015g00000XyzAbCdE\", externalAccountId=\"0015g00000XyzAbCdE\"`\n\n**Returns:** Single marketing event object.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_marketing_event_attendees</summary>\n\nGet attendees registered for a specific marketing event.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Unique identifier for the marketing event\n\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum number of attendees to return. Defaults to 10, maximum 100\n\u2022 `after` (optional): Cursor for pagination\n\n**Prerequisites:** The externalEventId can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Get all attendees for event: `externalEventId=\"gads-456-7890\"`\n- Limit attendees returned: `externalEventId=\"gads-456-7890\", limit=50`\n- Paginate through attendees: Use `after` cursor from previous response\n\n**Returns:** List of attendee objects with attendee_id, event_id, contact_id, registration_date, and status.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_form_global_event_subscription_definitions</summary>\n\nGet all available subscription type definitions for form events. This returns the catalog of subscription types you can use, not your active subscriptions (use `get_form_global_event_subscriptions` for that).\n\n**Parameters:** None\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- View all available subscription types and their frequencies (Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly)\n- Check what subscription options exist before creating one\n- Browse subscription names and descriptions to find the right type for your webhook needs\n\n**Returns:** Array of subscription definition objects.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_form_global_event_subscriptions</summary>\n\nGets all active webhook subscriptions for global form events. Returns your actual webhook configurations, including endpoints and subscription details.\n\n**Parameters:** None\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- List all webhook subscriptions you've created\n- Check which endpoints are receiving form event notifications\n- Get subscription IDs needed for update or delete operations\n\n**Returns:** Array of subscription objects.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>get_marketing_email_by_id</summary>\n\nRetrieves a specific marketing email by its UUID.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `email_id` (required): UUID of the marketing email\n\n**Prerequisites:** Email ID can be obtained from the marketing_emails collection in state.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Get specific email: `email_id=\"ccf9d6ad-dd24-42c3-8592-f5e2688b36b2\"`\n- Check email content before cloning\n\n**Returns:** Single marketing email object.\n\n</details>\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"write-tools\">\n<summary>\u270f\ufe0f State-Changing Tools</summary>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>create_template</summary>\n\nCreate a new email template in Design Manager.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `source` (required): The template source code/content with optional personalization tokens\n\u2022 `created` (optional): Creation timestamp in milliseconds since epoch as string. Defaults to current time\n\u2022 `template_type` (optional): Template type integer. Defaults to 2 (Email). Valid values: 2 (Email), 4 (Page), 11 (Error), 12 (Subscription preferences), 13 (Backup unsubscribe), 14 (Subscriptions update confirmation), 19 (Password prompt), 27 (Search results), 29 (Membership login), 30 (Membership registration), 31 (Membership reset password confirmation), 32 (Membership reset password request)\n\u2022 `category_id` (optional): Category type integer. Defaults to 2 (Email). Valid values: 0 (Unmapped), 1 (Landing Pages), 2 (Email), 3 (Blog Post), 4 (Site Page)\n\u2022 `folder` (optional): Folder path to save template. Defaults to '/templates/'\n\u2022 `path` (optional): Full path to save template. Defaults to '/home/templates/'\n\u2022 `is_available_for_new_content` (optional): Boolean indicating availability for new content. Defaults to false\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Create simple email template: `source=\"Hi {{contact.firstname}}, Welcome!\"`\n- Create with folder: `source=\"...\", folder=\"/marketing/emails/\"`\n- Make available for content: `source=\"...\", is_available_for_new_content=true`\n\n**State Changes:** Adds new template to templates collection with auto-generated numeric ID. Creates initial version with version_id=\"1\". Sets created timestamp, archived=false, and deleted_at=null.\n\n**Returns:** Complete template object including generated ID and initial version.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>update_template_by_id</summary>\n\nUpdates an existing template. Only provided fields are updated; others remain unchanged.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `template_id` (required): Numeric identifier of template to update\n\u2022 `category_id` (optional): Category type (0-4)\n\u2022 `folder` (optional): Folder path\n\u2022 `template_type` (optional): Template type (2, 4, 11, etc.)\n\u2022 `source` (optional): Template source code\n\u2022 `path` (optional): Full path in Design Manager\n\u2022 `created` (optional): Creation timestamp in milliseconds since epoch\n\u2022 `is_available_for_new_content` (optional): Availability boolean\n\u2022 `versions` (optional): Array of version objects with `source` and `version_id` fields\n\u2022 `label` (optional): Template label\n\n**Prerequisites:** Template ID can be obtained from `get_templates`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Update template source: `template_id=\"296483214\", source=\"New content\"`\n- Change availability: `template_id=\"296483214\", is_available_for_new_content=true`\n- Add new version: `template_id=\"296483214\", versions=[{...}, {...}]`\n\n**State Changes:** Updates only specified fields in the template object. Other fields retain existing values. If versions array is provided, it replaces the entire versions array.\n\n**Returns:** Updated template object with all current values.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>delete_template_by_id</summary>\n\nMarks a template as deleted (soft delete). Can be restored later.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `template_id` (required): Numeric identifier of template to delete\n\u2022 `deleted_at` (optional): Deletion timestamp in milliseconds since epoch as string. Defaults to current time\n\n**Prerequisites:** Template ID can be obtained from `get_templates`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Delete template: `template_id=\"296483214\"`\n- Delete with specific timestamp: `template_id=\"296483214\", deleted_at=\"1743500000000\"`\n\n**State Changes:** Sets the `deleted_at` field to provided or current timestamp. Template remains in database and can be restored. Does not remove template from templates collection.\n\n**Returns:** `None`\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>restore_deleted_template</summary>\n\nRestores a previously deleted template by clearing its deleted_at timestamp.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `template_id` (required): Numeric identifier of template to restore\n\n**Prerequisites:** Template must exist and have a non-null `deleted_at` value. Template ID can be obtained from `get_templates` with `deleted_at` filter.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Restore deleted template: `template_id=\"296483214\"`\n- Undo accidental deletion: Restore immediately after delete\n\n**State Changes:** Sets `deleted_at` field to null, making template active again.\n\n**Returns:** Restored template object.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>create_campaign</summary>\n\nCreates a new marketing campaign.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `name` (required): Campaign name\n\u2022 `slug` (optional): URL-friendly campaign identifier\n\u2022 `description` (optional): Campaign description\n\u2022 `start_year` (optional): Start year as integer\n\u2022 `start_month` (optional): Start month (1-12) as integer\n\u2022 `start_day` (optional): Start day (1-31) as integer\n\u2022 `end_year` (optional): End year as integer\n\u2022 `end_month` (optional): End month (1-12) as integer\n\u2022 `end_day` (optional): End day (1-31) as integer\n\u2022 `theme` (optional): Campaign theme\n\u2022 `resource` (optional): Resource identifier\n\u2022 `color_label` (optional): Color label for organization\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Create minimal campaign: `name=\"Q1 2025 Promotion\"`\n- Create with dates: `name=\"Spring Sale\", start_year=2025, start_month=3, start_day=1, end_year=2025, end_month=3, end_day=31`\n- Create with theme: `name=\"Holiday Campaign\", theme=\"Winter\", color_label=\"Holiday\"`\n\n**State Changes:** Adds new campaign to campaigns collection with auto-generated UUID. Sets created_at timestamp.\n\n**Returns:** Complete campaign object with generated ID and all provided fields.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>update_campaign</summary>\n\nUpdates an existing campaign with new values. Only updates specified fields.\n\n**BUG** This function crashes with KeyError unless the campaign includes all of `start_year`, `start_month`, `start_day`, `end_year`, `end_month`, `end_day` fields, regardless of the type of update you're making. Make sure all of these are present in any campaign you want to modify!\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `campaign_id` (required): UUID of campaign to update\n\u2022 `name` (optional): New campaign name\n\u2022 `slug` (optional): New slug\n\u2022 `description` (optional): New description\n\u2022 `start_year` (optional): New start year\n\u2022 `start_month` (optional): New start month\n\u2022 `start_day` (optional): New start day\n\u2022 `end_year` (optional): New end year\n\u2022 `end_month` (optional): New end month\n\u2022 `end_day` (optional): New end day\n\u2022 `theme` (optional): New theme\n\u2022 `resource` (optional): New resource\n\u2022 `color_label` (optional): New color label\n\n**Prerequisites:** Campaign ID must exist. Can be obtained from `get_campaigns`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Update name: `campaign_id=\"35110ef2-819b-40de-a972-1f4161e24649\", name=\"Updated Name\"`\n- Extend end date: `campaign_id=\"...\", end_month=6, end_day=30`\n- Change theme: `campaign_id=\"...\", theme=\"Summer\"`\n\n**State Changes:** Updates only provided fields in the campaign object. Sets updated_at timestamp to current time. Other fields remain unchanged.\n\n**Returns:** Updated campaign object.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>archive_campaign</summary>\n\nArchives a campaign, marking it as inactive.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `campaign_id` (required): UUID of campaign to archive\n\n**Prerequisites:** Campaign ID must exist and must be a valid UUID format. Can be obtained from `get_campaigns`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Archive completed campaign: `campaign_id=\"35110ef2-819b-40de-a972-1f4161e24649\"`\n- Remove campaign from active list: Archive instead of deleting\n\n**State Changes:** Marks campaign as archived (implementation may vary - could set archived flag or status).\n\n**Returns:** Boolean - True if successfully archived, False otherwise.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>create_form</summary>\n\nCreates a new marketing form with specified field configuration.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `name` (required): Form name (non-empty string)\n\u2022 `submitText` (required): Text for submit button (non-empty string)\n\u2022 `fieldGroups` (required): Array of field group objects, each containing:\n  - `groupType` (required): Field group type string\n  - `richTextType` (required): Rich text type (default: 'text')\n  - `richText` (required): HTML or text content\n  - `fields` (required): Array of field objects with:\n    - `fieldType` (required): Field type - one of: `email`, `phone`, `mobile_phone`, `single_line_text`, `multi_line_text`, `number`, `single_checkbox`, `multiple_checkboxes`, `dropdown`, `radio`, `datepicker`, `file`, `payment_link_radio`\n    - `name` (required): Field identifier/name\n    - `label` (required): Display label for the field\n    - `required` (required): Boolean indicating if field is required for submission\n    - `placeholder` (optional): Placeholder text\n    - `defaultValue` (optional): Default field value\n    - `options` (optional): Array of strings for dropdown/radio/checkbox options\n    - `hidden` (optional): Boolean indicating if field is hidden\n\u2022 `legalConsentOptions` (optional): Legal consent configuration for GDPR compliance. Object with:\n  - `explicitConsentToProcess` (optional): Explicit consent configuration object with:\n    - `communicationsCheckboxes` (array): Array of checkbox objects, each with:\n      - `subscriptionTypeId` (integer, required): ID of subscription type\n      - `label` (string, required): Checkbox label text\n      - `required` (boolean, required): Whether checkbox must be checked\n    - `communicationConsentText` (string, required): Text explaining communication consent\n    - `consentToProcessCheckboxLabel` (string, required): Label for consent to process checkbox\n    - `consentToProcessFooterText` (string, required): Footer text for consent section\n    - `type` (string, required): Consent type identifier\n    - `privacyText` (string, required): Privacy policy text\n    - `consentToProcessText` (string, required): Text explaining data processing consent\n  - `implicitConsentToProcess` (optional): Implicit consent configuration object with:\n    - `communicationsCheckboxes` (array): Array of checkbox objects (same structure as explicit consent)\n    - `communicationConsentText` (string, required): Communication consent text\n    - `type` (string, required): Consent type identifier\n    - `privacyText` (string, required): Privacy text\n    - `consentToProcessText` (string, required): Consent to process text\n  - `legitimateInterest` (optional): Legitimate interest configuration object with:\n    - `lawfulBasis` (string, required): Legal basis for legitimate interest\n    - `type` (string, required): Type of legitimate interest\n    - `privacyText` (string, required): Privacy policy text\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Create simple email form: `name=\"Newsletter Signup\", submitText=\"Subscribe\", fieldGroups=[{groupType=\"default\", richTextType=\"text\", richText=\"\", fields=[{fieldType=\"email\", name=\"email\", label=\"Email\", required=true}]}]`\n- Create form with explicit consent: Include `legalConsentOptions={explicitConsentToProcess={communicationsCheckboxes=[{subscriptionTypeId=1, label=\"I agree to receive marketing emails\", required=true}], communicationConsentText=\"We'll send you updates\", consentToProcessCheckboxLabel=\"I consent\", consentToProcessFooterText=\"See our privacy policy\", type=\"EXPLICIT\", privacyText=\"Privacy policy\", consentToProcessText=\"We process your data\"}}`\n\n**State Changes:** Adds new form to forms collection with auto-generated UUID. Sets createdAt and updatedAt timestamps.\n\n**Returns:** Complete form object with generated ID.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>update_form</summary>\n\nUpdate an existing marketing form's fields.\n\n**KEY UPDATE BEHAVIOR:** Only updates specified parameter fields, but providing `fieldGroups` or `legalConsentOptions` replaces the entire field, not individual items within it.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `formId` (required): UUID of form to update (non-empty string)\n\u2022 `name` (optional): New form name\n\u2022 `submitText` (optional): **BUG! incorrectly updates submit button text - do not use** New submit button text.\n\u2022 `fieldGroups` (optional): New field groups array (replaces entire array; see create_form for parameter structure)\n\u2022 `legalConsentOptions` (optional): New legal consent options (replaces entire object; see create_form for parameter structure)\n\n**Prerequisites:** Form ID can be obtained from `get_forms`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Update form name: `formId=\"d3c547d5-d7ca-4a82-ac45-a82bcb3f4f32\", name=\"Updated Form\"`\n- Change submit text: `formId=\"...\", submitText=\"Sign Up Now\"`\n- Replace field groups: `formId=\"...\", fieldGroups=[{...new structure...}]`\n\n**State Changes:** Updates only specified fields. Note that dictionary-type fields like `fieldGroups` and `legalConsentOptions` are replaced entirely, not merged. Updates updatedAt timestamp.\n\n**Returns:** Updated form object.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>delete_form</summary>\n\nDelete a form permanently from the system.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `formId` (required): UUID of form to delete\n\n**Prerequisites:** Form ID must exist. Can be obtained from `get_forms` or database.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Delete form: `formId=\"d3c547d5-d7ca-4a82-ac45-a82bcb3f4f32\"`\n\n**State Changes:** Removes form completely from forms collection. This operation cannot be undone.\n\n**Returns:** `None`\n\n**Warning:** Permanent deletion - form cannot be recovered.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>create_marketing_event</summary>\n\nCreate a new marketing event with external system integration.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Unique identifier from external system\n\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\n\u2022 `event_name` (required): Event display name\n\u2022 `event_type` (required): Event type (e.g., Webinar, Conference, Trade Show)\n\u2022 `event_organizer` (required): Organizer name\n\u2022 `start_date_time` (optional): Start timestamp in ISO 8601 format\n\u2022 `end_date_time` (optional): End timestamp in ISO 8601 format\n\u2022 `event_description` (optional): Event description\n\u2022 `event_url` (optional): URL for event information\n\u2022 `custom_properties` (optional): Array of dictionaries with any string keys. Values can be strings, integers, booleans, or floats. No restrictions on key names (unlike update_marketing_event which requires specific structure).\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Create basic event: `externalEventId=\"webinar-001\", externalAccountId=\"acct-123\", event_name=\"Product Demo\", event_type=\"Webinar\", event_organizer=\"Sales Team\"`\n- Create with times: Include `start_date_time=\"2025-06-01T14:00:00\"` and `end_date_time=\"2025-06-01T15:00:00\"`\n- Add custom properties: `custom_properties=[{\"location\": \"Virtual\", \"capacity\": 100, \"is_featured\": true, \"price\": 29.99}]`\n\n**State Changes:** Adds new event to marketing_events collection keyed by externalEventId. Sets createdAt and updatedAt timestamps. Initializes empty attendees object.\n\n**Returns:** Complete marketing event object with all provided fields.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>update_marketing_event</summary>\n\nUpdate an existing marketing event's information.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\n\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\n\u2022 `registrants` (optional): Number of registrations (integer)\n\u2022 `event_name` (optional): New event name\n\u2022 `event_type` (optional): New event type\n\u2022 `start_date_time` (optional): New start time (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS format)\n\u2022 `end_date_time` (optional): New end time (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS format)\n\u2022 `event_organizer` (optional): New organizer name\n\u2022 `event_description` (optional): New description\n\u2022 `event_url` (optional): New URL\n\u2022 `attendees` (optional): Number of attendees (positive integer)\n\u2022 `no_shows` (optional): Number of no-shows (positive integer)\n\u2022 `event_completed` (optional): Boolean completion status\n\u2022 `custom_properties` (optional): Array of property objects. Each object MUST include `subscriptionDetails` field (can be empty `{}`). Optional fields: `name`, `value`, `sourceId`, `selectedByUser`, `sourceLabel`, `source`, `updatedByUserId`, `persistenceTimestamp`, `sourceMetadata`, `dataSensitivity`, `unit`, `requestId`, `isEncrypted`, `useTimestampAsPersistenceTimestamp`, `selectedByUserTimestamp`, `timestamp`, `isLargeValue`, `endpoint`, `active`. Does not accept arbitrary keys like create_marketing_event. Replaces entire array.\n\n**Prerequisites:** Event must exist with matching externalEventId and externalAccountId. Can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Update registrant count: `externalEventId=\"webinar-001\", externalAccountId=\"acct-123\", registrants=150`\n- Mark as completed: `externalEventId=\"...\", externalAccountId=\"...\", event_completed=true`\n- Update attendance: `externalEventId=\"...\", externalAccountId=\"...\", attendees=120, no_shows=15`\n- Update custom properties: `externalEventId=\"...\", externalAccountId=\"...\", custom_properties=[{\"subscriptionDetails\": {}, \"name\": \"mode\", \"value\": \"hybrid\"}]`\n\n**State Changes:** Updates only specified fields in the event object. Updates updatedAt timestamp.\n\n**Returns:** Updated marketing event object.\n\n**Behavior Notes:** The call will fail if both start and end datetime include timezone info (e.g., 2024-03-15T10:30:00**Z** or 2024-03-15T10:30:00 **+00:00**)\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>cancel_marketing_event</summary>\n\nMarks a marketing event as cancelled.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\n\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\n\n**Prerequisites:** Event identifiers can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Cancel event: `externalEventId=\"webinar-001\", externalAccountId=\"acct-123\"`\n- Mark event as not happening: Use when event is no longer taking place\n\n**State Changes:** Sets `eventCancelled` field to true for the event. Does NOT update updatedAt timestamp.\n\n**Returns:** Updated event object with cancellation status.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>delete_marketing_event</summary>\n\nDelete a marketing event permanently from the system.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\n\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\n\n**Prerequisites:** Event must exist with matching identifiers. Can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Delete event: `externalEventId=\"webinar-001\", externalAccountId=\"acct-123\"`\n- Remove completed event: Delete after event is finished and data is no longer needed\n\n**State Changes:** Removes event completely from marketing_events collection. All associated attendee data is also removed (attendees are nested within the event object).\n\n**Returns:** `None`\n\n**Warning:** Permanent deletion - cannot be undone.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>create_or_update_marketing_event_attendee</summary>\n\nCreate or update an attendee record for a marketing event.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\n\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\n\u2022 `email` (required): Attendee email address\n\u2022 `joinedAt` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp when attendee joined\n\u2022 `leftAt` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp when attendee left\n\n**Prerequisites:** Event must exist with matching externalEventId and externalAccountId. Can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Register attendee: `externalEventId=\"webinar-001\", externalAccountId=\"acct-123\", email=\"attendee@gmail.com\"`\n- Track attendance: `externalEventId=\"...\", externalAccountId=\"...\", email=\"...\", joinedAt=\"2025-06-01T14:05:00\", leftAt=\"2025-06-01T15:10:00\"`\n\n**State Changes:** If attendee email doesn't exist for this event, creates new attendee record with hash-based attendee ID (8-character hash of eventId + email). If email already exists for this event, updates the existing record's `joinedAt` and `leftAt` fields only. Associates attendee with event.\n\n**Returns:** Attendee object with attendee_id, event reference, email, and timestamps.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>delete_marketing_event_attendee</summary>\n\nRemove an attendee from a marketing event.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\n\u2022 `attendeeId` (required): Unique identifier for the attendee\n\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\n\n**Prerequisites:** Event and attendee must exist. Attendee ID can be obtained from `get_marketing_event_attendees`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Remove attendee: `externalEventId=\"webinar-001\", attendeeId=\"a1b2c3d4...\", externalAccountId=\"acct-123\"`\n\n**State Changes:** Removes attendee record from event's attendees collection. Does NOT automatically update aggregate counts (registrants, attendees, no_shows, etc.) on the event object.\n\n**Returns:** `None`\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>create_marketing_email</summary>\n\nCreates a new marketing email with promotional fields.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `name` (required): Internal email name\n\u2022 `subject` (optional): Email subject line. Defaults to None\n\u2022 `htmlBody` (optional): HTML email content. Defaults to None\n\u2022 `isTransactional` (optional): Boolean flag. Defaults to false\n\u2022 `status` (optional): Email status (e.g., 'scheduled', 'sent'). Defaults to None\n\u2022 `discount_code` (optional): Promotional discount code. Defaults to None\n\u2022 `expiration` (optional): Expiration date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to None\n\u2022 `launch_date` (optional): Product launch date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to None\n\u2022 `sale_end_date` (optional): Sale end date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to None\n\u2022 `reward_points` (optional): Loyalty program points (integer). Defaults to None\n\u2022 `access_code` (optional): VIP access code. Defaults to None\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Create basic email: `name=\"Weekly Newsletter\"`\n- Create promotional email: `name=\"Spring Sale\", subject=\"50% Off!\", discount_code=\"SPRING50\", expiration=\"2025-04-30\"`\n- Create loyalty email: `name=\"Points Earned\", reward_points=500`\n\n**State Changes:** Adds new email to marketing_emails collection with auto-generated UUID.\n\n**Returns:** Success object with `success` (boolean), `message` (string), and `email_id` (UUID string).\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>update_marketing_email</summary>\n\nUpdates an existing marketing email's specified fields.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `email_id` (required): UUID of email to update\n\u2022 `name` (optional): New internal name\n\u2022 `subject` (optional): New subject line\n\u2022 `htmlBody` (optional): New HTML content\n\u2022 `isTransactional` (optional): New transactional flag\n\u2022 `status` (optional): New status\n\u2022 `discount_code` (optional): New discount code\n\u2022 `expiration` (optional): New expiration date\n\u2022 `launch_date` (optional): New launch date\n\u2022 `sale_end_date` (optional): New sale end date\n\u2022 `reward_points` (optional): New reward points value\n\u2022 `access_code` (optional): New access code\n\n**Prerequisites:** Email ID can be obtained from `get_marketing_email_by_id`.\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Update subject: `email_id=\"ccf9d6ad-dd24-42c3-8592-f5e2688b36b2\", subject=\"New Subject\"`\n- Extend expiration: `email_id=\"...\", expiration=\"2025-05-31\"`\n- Change status: `email_id=\"...\", status=\"sent\"`\n\n**State Changes:** Updates only specified fields in the email object.\n\n**Returns:** Success object with `success` (boolean) and `message` (string).\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>delete_marketing_email</summary>\n\nDeletes a marketing email permanently.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `email_id` (required): UUID of email to delete\n\n**Prerequisites:** Email ID must exist. Can be obtained from `get_marketing_email_by_id`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Delete email: `email_id=\"ccf9d6ad-dd24-42c3-8592-f5e2688b36b2\"`\n- Remove obsolete campaign: Delete when no longer needed\n\n**State Changes:** Removes email completely from marketing_emails collection.\n\n**Returns:** Success object with `success` (boolean) and `message` (string).\n\n**Warning:** Permanent deletion - cannot be undone.\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>clone_marketing_email</summary>\n\nClones an existing marketing email to create a duplicate with a new name.\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `email_id` (required): UUID of email to clone\n\u2022 `name` (required): Name for the new cloned email\n\n**Prerequisites:** Source email ID can be obtained from `get_marketing_email_by_id`.\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Clone for new campaign: `email_id=\"ccf9d6ad-dd24-42c3-8592-f5e2688b36b2\", name=\"Summer 2025 Version\"`\n- Duplicate template: Clone successful email for reuse with modifications\n\n**State Changes:** Creates new email in marketing_emails collection with auto-generated UUID. Copies all fields from source email except id and name.\n\n**Returns:** Success object with `email_id` (UUID of cloned email), `success` (boolean), and `message` (string).\n\n</details>\n\n<details class=\"tool\">\n<summary>send_transactional_email</summary>\n\nSends a single transactional email (order confirmation, password reset, etc.).\n\n**Parameters:**\n\u2022 `message` (required): Message object containing:\n  - `to` (required): Recipient email address\n  - `from` (required): Sender email address\n  - `subject` (required): Email subject line\n  - `htmlBody` (required): HTML email content\n  - `cc` (optional): Array of CC email addresses\n  - `bcc` (optional): Array of BCC email addresses\n  - `replyTo` (optional): Reply-to email address\n\u2022 `customProperties` (optional): Object with custom key-value pairs for personalization\n\n**Usage Examples:**\n- Send order confirmation: `message={to=\"customer@gmail.com\", from=\"support@gmail.com\", subject=\"Order Confirmation\", htmlBody=\"<p>Your order #12345 is confirmed</p>\"}, customProperties={order_id=12345}`\n- Send password reset: `message={to=\"user@gmail.com\", from=\"support@gmail.com\", subject=\"Password Reset\", htmlBody=\"<p>Click here to reset...</p>\"}`\n\n**State Changes:** Creates new email record in transactional_emails collection with auto-generated UUID. Email is stored in array format keyed by UUID.
