`offset`.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_campaign_by_id</summary>\\n\\nGets a single campaign by its UUID identifier.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `campaign_id` (required): UUID of the campaign\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Campaign ID can be obtained from `get_campaigns`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get specific campaign: `campaign_id=\\\"35110ef2-819b-40de-a972-1f4161e24649\\\"`\\n- View campaign details before updating: Retrieve to check current values\\n\\n**Returns:** Single campaign object.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_forms</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves marketing forms with options for filtering.\\n\\n**BUG - cannot handle pagination! Do not use `after` or `limit` parameters, or set the per-page limit higher than the number of matching results.**\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `after` (optional): Form ID to start after for pagination\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum number of forms to return per page\\n\\u2022 `created_at` (optional): Filter by exact creation date (ISO 8601 format)\\n\\u2022 `created_at__gt` (optional): Filter forms created after date\\n\\u2022 `created_at__gte` (optional): Filter forms created on or after date\\n\\u2022 `created_at__lt` (optional): Filter forms created before date\\n\\u2022 `created_at__lte` (optional): Filter forms created on or before date\\n\\u2022 `updated_at` (optional): Filter by exact update date (ISO 8601 format)\\n\\u2022 `updated_at__gt` (optional): Filter forms updated after date\\n\\u2022 `updated_at__gte` (optional): Filter forms updated on or after date\\n\\u2022 `updated_at__lt` (optional): Filter forms updated before date\\n\\u2022 `updated_at__lte` (optional): Filter forms updated on or before date\\n\\u2022 `name` (optional): Filter by exact form name\\n\\u2022 `id` (optional): Filter by exact form ID\\n\\u2022 `archived` (optional): Filter by archived status\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- List all forms: No parameters\\n- Get forms created in 2024: `created_at__gte=\\\"2024-01-01T00:00:00\\\"`\\n- Find form by name: `name=\\\"Contact Us\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Array of form objects.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_form_by_id</summary>\\n\\nGet a specific marketing form by its UUID.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `formId` (required): UUID of the form\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Form ID can be obtained from `get_forms`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get specific form: `formId=\\\"d3c547d5-d7ca-4a82-ac45-a82bcb3f4f32\\\"`\\n- View form structure before updating: Retrieve to see current field configuration\\n\\n**Returns:** Single form object.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_marketing_events</summary>\\n\\nGet all marketing events with optional time-based filtering and pagination.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `occurredAfter` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp to filter events after this time\\n\\u2022 `occurredBefore` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp to filter events before this time\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum number of events to return (1-100). Defaults to 10\\n\\u2022 `after` (optional): Cursor for pagination to fetch next set of results\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- List all events: No parameters\\n- Get recent events: `occurredAfter=\\\"2024-01-01T00:00:00\\\"`\\n- Limit results: `limit=5`\\n- Filter by date range: `occurredAfter=\\\"2024-01-01T00:00:00\\\", occurredBefore=\\\"2024-12-31T23:59:59\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Array of marketing event objects.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_marketing_event_by_id</summary>\\n\\nGet a specific marketing event by its external identifiers.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Unique identifier from the external system where event was created\\n\\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from the external system\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Both externalEventId and externalAccountId can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get Google Ads event: `externalEventId=\\\"gads-456-7890\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"123-456-7890\\\"`\\n- Get Salesforce event: `externalEventId=\\\"sf-0015g00000XyzAbCdE\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"0015g00000XyzAbCdE\\\"`\\n\\n**Returns:** Single marketing event object.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_marketing_event_attendees</summary>\\n\\nGet attendees registered for a specific marketing event.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Unique identifier for the marketing event\\n\\u2022 `limit` (optional): Maximum number of attendees to return. Defaults to 10, maximum 100\\n\\u2022 `after` (optional): Cursor for pagination\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** The externalEventId can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get all attendees for event: `externalEventId=\\\"gads-456-7890\\\"`\\n- Limit attendees returned: `externalEventId=\\\"gads-456-7890\\\", limit=50`\\n- Paginate through attendees: Use `after` cursor from previous response\\n\\n**Returns:** List of attendee objects with attendee_id, event_id, contact_id, registration_date, and status.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_form_global_event_subscription_definitions</summary>\\n\\nGet all available subscription type definitions for form events. This returns the catalog of subscription types you can use, not your active subscriptions (use `get_form_global_event_subscriptions` for that).\\n\\n**Parameters:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- View all available subscription types and their frequencies (Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly)\\n- Check what subscription options exist before creating one\\n- Browse subscription names and descriptions to find the right type for your webhook needs\\n\\n**Returns:** Array of subscription definition objects.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_form_global_event_subscriptions</summary>\\n\\nGets all active webhook subscriptions for global form events. Returns your actual webhook configurations, including endpoints and subscription details.\\n\\n**Parameters:** None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- List all webhook subscriptions you've created\\n- Check which endpoints are receiving form event notifications\\n- Get subscription IDs needed for update or delete operations\\n\\n**Returns:** Array of subscription objects.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>get_marketing_email_by_id</summary>\\n\\nRetrieves a specific marketing email by its UUID.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `email_id` (required): UUID of the marketing email\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Email ID can be obtained from the marketing_emails collection in state.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Get specific email: `email_id=\\\"ccf9d6ad-dd24-42c3-8592-f5e2688b36b2\\\"`\\n- Check email content before cloning\\n\\n**Returns:** Single marketing email object.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"write-tools\\\">\\n<summary>\\u270f\\ufe0f State-Changing Tools</summary>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_template</summary>\\n\\nCreate a new email template in Design Manager.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `source` (required): The template source code/content with optional personalization tokens\\n\\u2022 `created` (optional): Creation timestamp in milliseconds since epoch as string. Defaults to current time\\n\\u2022 `template_type` (optional): Template type integer. Defaults to 2 (Email). Valid values: 2 (Email), 4 (Page), 11 (Error), 12 (Subscription preferences), 13 (Backup unsubscribe), 14 (Subscriptions update confirmation), 19 (Password prompt), 27 (Search results), 29 (Membership login), 30 (Membership registration), 31 (Membership reset password confirmation), 32 (Membership reset password request)\\n\\u2022 `category_id` (optional): Category type integer. Defaults to 2 (Email). Valid values: 0 (Unmapped), 1 (Landing Pages), 2 (Email), 3 (Blog Post), 4 (Site Page)\\n\\u2022 `folder` (optional): Folder path to save template. Defaults to '/templates/'\\n\\u2022 `path` (optional): Full path to save template. Defaults to '/home/templates/'\\n\\u2022 `is_available_for_new_content` (optional): Boolean indicating availability for new content. Defaults to false\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Create simple email template: `source=\\\"Hi {{contact.firstname}}, Welcome!\\\"`\\n- Create with folder: `source=\\\"...\\\", folder=\\\"/marketing/emails/\\\"`\\n- Make available for content: `source=\\\"...\\\", is_available_for_new_content=true`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds new template to templates collection with auto-generated numeric ID. Creates initial version with version_id=\\\"1\\\". Sets created timestamp, archived=false, and deleted_at=null.\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete template object including generated ID and initial version.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>update_template_by_id</summary>\\n\\nUpdates an existing template. Only provided fields are updated; others remain unchanged.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `template_id` (required): Numeric identifier of template to update\\n\\u2022 `category_id` (optional): Category type (0-4)\\n\\u2022 `folder` (optional): Folder path\\n\\u2022 `template_type` (optional): Template type (2, 4, 11, etc.)\\n\\u2022 `source` (optional): Template source code\\n\\u2022 `path` (optional): Full path in Design Manager\\n\\u2022 `created` (optional): Creation timestamp in milliseconds since epoch\\n\\u2022 `is_available_for_new_content` (optional): Availability boolean\\n\\u2022 `versions` (optional): Array of version objects with `source` and `version_id` fields\\n\\u2022 `label` (optional): Template label\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Template ID can be obtained from `get_templates`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Update template source: `template_id=\\\"296483214\\\", source=\\\"New content\\\"`\\n- Change availability: `template_id=\\\"296483214\\\", is_available_for_new_content=true`\\n- Add new version: `template_id=\\\"296483214\\\", versions=[{...}, {...}]`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates only specified fields in the template object. Other fields retain existing values. If versions array is provided, it replaces the entire versions array.\\n\\n**Returns:** Updated template object with all current values.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>delete_template_by_id</summary>\\n\\nMarks a template as deleted (soft delete). Can be restored later.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `template_id` (required): Numeric identifier of template to delete\\n\\u2022 `deleted_at` (optional): Deletion timestamp in milliseconds since epoch as string. Defaults to current time\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Template ID can be obtained from `get_templates`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Delete template: `template_id=\\\"296483214\\\"`\\n- Delete with specific timestamp: `template_id=\\\"296483214\\\", deleted_at=\\\"1743500000000\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Sets the `deleted_at` field to provided or current timestamp. Template remains in database and can be restored. Does not remove template from templates collection.\\n\\n**Returns:** `None`\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>restore_deleted_template</summary>\\n\\nRestores a previously deleted template by clearing its deleted_at timestamp.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `template_id` (required): Numeric identifier of template to restore\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Template must exist and have a non-null `deleted_at` value. Template ID can be obtained from `get_templates` with `deleted_at` filter.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Restore deleted template: `template_id=\\\"296483214\\\"`\\n- Undo accidental deletion: Restore immediately after delete\\n\\n**State Changes:** Sets `deleted_at` field to null, making template active again.\\n\\n**Returns:** Restored template object.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_campaign</summary>\\n\\nCreates a new marketing campaign.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `name` (required): Campaign name\\n\\u2022 `slug` (optional): URL-friendly campaign identifier\\n\\u2022 `description` (optional): Campaign description\\n\\u2022 `start_year` (optional): Start year as integer\\n\\u2022 `start_month` (optional): Start month (1-12) as integer\\n\\u2022 `start_day` (optional): Start day (1-31) as integer\\n\\u2022 `end_year` (optional): End year as integer\\n\\u2022 `end_month` (optional): End month (1-12) as integer\\n\\u2022 `end_day` (optional): End day (1-31) as integer\\n\\u2022 `theme` (optional): Campaign theme\\n\\u2022 `resource` (optional): Resource identifier\\n\\u2022 `color_label` (optional): Color label for organization\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Create minimal campaign: `name=\\\"Q1 2025 Promotion\\\"`\\n- Create with dates: `name=\\\"Spring Sale\\\", start_year=2025, start_month=3, start_day=1, end_year=2025, end_month=3, end_day=31`\\n- Create with theme: `name=\\\"Holiday Campaign\\\", theme=\\\"Winter\\\", color_label=\\\"Holiday\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds new campaign to campaigns collection with auto-generated UUID. Sets created_at timestamp.\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete campaign object with generated ID and all provided fields.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>update_campaign</summary>\\n\\nUpdates an existing campaign with new values. Only updates specified fields.\\n\\n**BUG** This function crashes with KeyError unless the campaign includes all of `start_year`, `start_month`, `start_day`, `end_year`, `end_month`, `end_day` fields, regardless of the type of update you're making. Make sure all of these are present in any campaign you want to modify!\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `campaign_id` (required): UUID of campaign to update\\n\\u2022 `name` (optional): New campaign name\\n\\u2022 `slug` (optional): New slug\\n\\u2022 `description` (optional): New description\\n\\u2022 `start_year` (optional): New start year\\n\\u2022 `start_month` (optional): New start month\\n\\u2022 `start_day` (optional): New start day\\n\\u2022 `end_year` (optional): New end year\\n\\u2022 `end_month` (optional): New end month\\n\\u2022 `end_day` (optional): New end day\\n\\u2022 `theme` (optional): New theme\\n\\u2022 `resource` (optional): New resource\\n\\u2022 `color_label` (optional): New color label\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Campaign ID must exist. Can be obtained from `get_campaigns`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Update name: `campaign_id=\\\"35110ef2-819b-40de-a972-1f4161e24649\\\", name=\\\"Updated Name\\\"`\\n- Extend end date: `campaign_id=\\\"...\\\", end_month=6, end_day=30`\\n- Change theme: `campaign_id=\\\"...\\\", theme=\\\"Summer\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates only provided fields in the campaign object. Sets updated_at timestamp to current time. Other fields remain unchanged.\\n\\n**Returns:** Updated campaign object.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>archive_campaign</summary>\\n\\nArchives a campaign, marking it as inactive.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `campaign_id` (required): UUID of campaign to archive\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Campaign ID must exist and must be a valid UUID format. Can be obtained from `get_campaigns`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Archive completed campaign: `campaign_id=\\\"35110ef2-819b-40de-a972-1f4161e24649\\\"`\\n- Remove campaign from active list: Archive instead of deleting\\n\\n**State Changes:** Marks campaign as archived (implementation may vary - could set archived flag or status).\\n\\n**Returns:** Boolean - True if successfully archived, False otherwise.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_form</summary>\\n\\nCreates a new marketing form with specified field configuration.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `name` (required): Form name (non-empty string)\\n\\u2022 `submitText` (required): Text for submit button (non-empty string)\\n\\u2022 `fieldGroups` (required): Array of field group objects, each containing:\\n  - `groupType` (required): Field group type string\\n  - `richTextType` (required): Rich text type (default: 'text')\\n  - `richText` (required): HTML or text content\\n  - `fields` (required): Array of field objects with:\\n    - `fieldType` (required): Field type - one of: `email`, `phone`, `mobile_phone`, `single_line_text`, `multi_line_text`, `number`, `single_checkbox`, `multiple_checkboxes`, `dropdown`, `radio`, `datepicker`, `file`, `payment_link_radio`\\n    - `name` (required): Field identifier/name\\n    - `label` (required): Display label for the field\\n    - `required` (required): Boolean indicating if field is required for submission\\n    - `placeholder` (optional): Placeholder text\\n    - `defaultValue` (optional): Default field value\\n    - `options` (optional): Array of strings for dropdown/radio/checkbox options\\n    - `hidden` (optional): Boolean indicating if field is hidden\\n\\u2022 `legalConsentOptions` (optional): Legal consent configuration for GDPR compliance. Object with:\\n  - `explicitConsentToProcess` (optional): Explicit consent configuration object with:\\n    - `communicationsCheckboxes` (array): Array of checkbox objects, each with:\\n      - `subscriptionTypeId` (integer, required): ID of subscription type\\n      - `label` (string, required): Checkbox label text\\n      - `required` (boolean, required): Whether checkbox must be checked\\n    - `communicationConsentText` (string, required): Text explaining communication consent\\n    - `consentToProcessCheckboxLabel` (string, required): Label for consent to process checkbox\\n    - `consentToProcessFooterText` (string, required): Footer text for consent section\\n    - `type` (string, required): Consent type identifier\\n    - `privacyText` (string, required): Privacy policy text\\n    - `consentToProcessText` (string, required): Text explaining data processing consent\\n  - `implicitConsentToProcess` (optional): Implicit consent configuration object with:\\n    - `communicationsCheckboxes` (array): Array of checkbox objects (same structure as explicit consent)\\n    - `communicationConsentText` (string, required): Communication consent text\\n    - `type` (string, required): Consent type identifier\\n    - `privacyText` (string, required): Privacy text\\n    - `consentToProcessText` (string, required): Consent to process text\\n  - `legitimateInterest` (optional): Legitimate interest configuration object with:\\n    - `lawfulBasis` (string, required): Legal basis for legitimate interest\\n    - `type` (string, required): Type of legitimate interest\\n    - `privacyText` (string, required): Privacy policy text\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Create simple email form: `name=\\\"Newsletter Signup\\\", submitText=\\\"Subscribe\\\", fieldGroups=[{groupType=\\\"default\\\", richTextType=\\\"text\\\", richText=\\\"\\\", fields=[{fieldType=\\\"email\\\", name=\\\"email\\\", label=\\\"Email\\\", required=true}]}]`\\n- Create form with explicit consent: Include `legalConsentOptions={explicitConsentToProcess={communicationsCheckboxes=[{subscriptionTypeId=1, label=\\\"I agree to receive marketing emails\\\", required=true}], communicationConsentText=\\\"We'll send you updates\\\", consentToProcessCheckboxLabel=\\\"I consent\\\", consentToProcessFooterText=\\\"See our privacy policy\\\", type=\\\"EXPLICIT\\\", privacyText=\\\"Privacy policy\\\", consentToProcessText=\\\"We process your data\\\"}}`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds new form to forms collection with auto-generated UUID. Sets createdAt and updatedAt timestamps.\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete form object with generated ID.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>update_form</summary>\\n\\nUpdate an existing marketing form's fields.\\n\\n**KEY UPDATE BEHAVIOR:** Only updates specified parameter fields, but providing `fieldGroups` or `legalConsentOptions` replaces the entire field, not individual items within it.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `formId` (required): UUID of form to update (non-empty string)\\n\\u2022 `name` (optional): New form name\\n\\u2022 `submitText` (optional): **BUG! incorrectly updates submit button text - do not use** New submit button text.\\n\\u2022 `fieldGroups` (optional): New field groups array (replaces entire array; see create_form for parameter structure)\\n\\u2022 `legalConsentOptions` (optional): New legal consent options (replaces entire object; see create_form for parameter structure)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Form ID can be obtained from `get_forms`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Update form name: `formId=\\\"d3c547d5-d7ca-4a82-ac45-a82bcb3f4f32\\\", name=\\\"Updated Form\\\"`\\n- Change submit text: `formId=\\\"...\\\", submitText=\\\"Sign Up Now\\\"`\\n- Replace field groups: `formId=\\\"...\\\", fieldGroups=[{...new structure...}]`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates only specified fields. Note that dictionary-type fields like `fieldGroups` and `legalConsentOptions` are replaced entirely, not merged. Updates updatedAt timestamp.\\n\\n**Returns:** Updated form object.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>delete_form</summary>\\n\\nDelete a form permanently from the system.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `formId` (required): UUID of form to delete\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Form ID must exist. Can be obtained from `get_forms` or database.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Delete form: `formId=\\\"d3c547d5-d7ca-4a82-ac45-a82bcb3f4f32\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Removes form completely from forms collection. This operation cannot be undone.\\n\\n**Returns:** `None`\\n\\n**Warning:** Permanent deletion - form cannot be recovered.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_marketing_event</summary>\\n\\nCreate a new marketing event with external system integration.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Unique identifier from external system\\n\\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\\n\\u2022 `event_name` (required): Event display name\\n\\u2022 `event_type` (required): Event type (e.g., Webinar, Conference, Trade Show)\\n\\u2022 `event_organizer` (required): Organizer name\\n\\u2022 `start_date_time` (optional): Start timestamp in ISO 8601 format\\n\\u2022 `end_date_time` (optional): End timestamp in ISO 8601 format\\n\\u2022 `event_description` (optional): Event description\\n\\u2022 `event_url` (optional): URL for event information\\n\\u2022 `custom_properties` (optional): Array of dictionaries with any string keys. Values can be strings, integers, booleans, or floats. No restrictions on key names (unlike update_marketing_event which requires specific structure).\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Create basic event: `externalEventId=\\\"webinar-001\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"acct-123\\\", event_name=\\\"Product Demo\\\", event_type=\\\"Webinar\\\", event_organizer=\\\"Sales Team\\\"`\\n- Create with times: Include `start_date_time=\\\"2025-06-01T14:00:00\\\"` and `end_date_time=\\\"2025-06-01T15:00:00\\\"`\\n- Add custom properties: `custom_properties=[{\\\"location\\\": \\\"Virtual\\\", \\\"capacity\\\": 100, \\\"is_featured\\\": true, \\\"price\\\": 29.99}]`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds new event to marketing_events collection keyed by externalEventId. Sets createdAt and updatedAt timestamps. Initializes empty attendees object.\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete marketing event object with all provided fields.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>update_marketing_event</summary>\\n\\nUpdate an existing marketing event's information.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\\n\\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\\n\\u2022 `registrants` (optional): Number of registrations (integer)\\n\\u2022 `event_name` (optional): New event name\\n\\u2022 `event_type` (optional): New event type\\n\\u2022 `start_date_time` (optional): New start time (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS format)\\n\\u2022 `end_date_time` (optional): New end time (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS format)\\n\\u2022 `event_organizer` (optional): New organizer name\\n\\u2022 `event_description` (optional): New description\\n\\u2022 `event_url` (optional): New URL\\n\\u2022 `attendees` (optional): Number of attendees (positive integer)\\n\\u2022 `no_shows` (optional): Number of no-shows (positive integer)\\n\\u2022 `event_completed` (optional): Boolean completion status\\n\\u2022 `custom_properties` (optional): Array of property objects. Each object MUST include `subscriptionDetails` field (can be empty `{}`). Optional fields: `name`, `value`, `sourceId`, `selectedByUser`, `sourceLabel`, `source`, `updatedByUserId`, `persistenceTimestamp`, `sourceMetadata`, `dataSensitivity`, `unit`, `requestId`, `isEncrypted`, `useTimestampAsPersistenceTimestamp`, `selectedByUserTimestamp`, `timestamp`, `isLargeValue`, `endpoint`, `active`. Does not accept arbitrary keys like create_marketing_event. Replaces entire array.\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Event must exist with matching externalEventId and externalAccountId. Can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Update registrant count: `externalEventId=\\\"webinar-001\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"acct-123\\\", registrants=150`\\n- Mark as completed: `externalEventId=\\\"...\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"...\\\", event_completed=true`\\n- Update attendance: `externalEventId=\\\"...\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"...\\\", attendees=120, no_shows=15`\\n- Update custom properties: `externalEventId=\\\"...\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"...\\\", custom_properties=[{\\\"subscriptionDetails\\\": {}, \\\"name\\\": \\\"mode\\\", \\\"value\\\": \\\"hybrid\\\"}]`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates only specified fields in the event object. Updates updatedAt timestamp.\\n\\n**Returns:** Updated marketing event object.\\n\\n**Behavior Notes:** The call will fail if both start and end datetime include timezone info (e.g., 2024-03-15T10:30:00**Z** or 2024-03-15T10:30:00 **+00:00**)\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>cancel_marketing_event</summary>\\n\\nMarks a marketing event as cancelled.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\\n\\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Event identifiers can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Cancel event: `externalEventId=\\\"webinar-001\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"acct-123\\\"`\\n- Mark event as not happening: Use when event is no longer taking place\\n\\n**State Changes:** Sets `eventCancelled` field to true for the event. Does NOT update updatedAt timestamp.\\n\\n**Returns:** Updated event object with cancellation status.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>delete_marketing_event</summary>\\n\\nDelete a marketing event permanently from the system.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\\n\\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Event must exist with matching identifiers. Can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Delete event: `externalEventId=\\\"webinar-001\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"acct-123\\\"`\\n- Remove completed event: Delete after event is finished and data is no longer needed\\n\\n**State Changes:** Removes event completely from marketing_events collection. All associated attendee data is also removed (attendees are nested within the event object).\\n\\n**Returns:** `None`\\n\\n**Warning:** Permanent deletion - cannot be undone.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_or_update_marketing_event_attendee</summary>\\n\\nCreate or update an attendee record for a marketing event.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\\n\\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\\n\\u2022 `email` (required): Attendee email address\\n\\u2022 `joinedAt` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp when attendee joined\\n\\u2022 `leftAt` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp when attendee left\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Event must exist with matching externalEventId and externalAccountId. Can be obtained from `get_marketing_events`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Register attendee: `externalEventId=\\\"webinar-001\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"acct-123\\\", email=\\\"attendee@gmail.com\\\"`\\n- Track attendance: `externalEventId=\\\"...\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"...\\\", email=\\\"...\\\", joinedAt=\\\"2025-06-01T14:05:00\\\", leftAt=\\\"2025-06-01T15:10:00\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** If attendee email doesn't exist for this event, creates new attendee record with hash-based attendee ID (8-character hash of eventId + email). If email already exists for this event, updates the existing record's `joinedAt` and `leftAt` fields only. Associates attendee with event.\\n\\n**Returns:** Attendee object with attendee_id, event reference, email, and timestamps.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>delete_marketing_event_attendee</summary>\\n\\nRemove an attendee from a marketing event.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `externalEventId` (required): Event identifier from external system\\n\\u2022 `attendeeId` (required): Unique identifier for the attendee\\n\\u2022 `externalAccountId` (required): Account identifier from external system\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Event and attendee must exist. Attendee ID can be obtained from `get_marketing_event_attendees`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Remove attendee: `externalEventId=\\\"webinar-001\\\", attendeeId=\\\"a1b2c3d4...\\\", externalAccountId=\\\"acct-123\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Removes attendee record from event's attendees collection. Does NOT automatically update aggregate counts (registrants, attendees, no_shows, etc.) on the event object.\\n\\n**Returns:** `None`\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_marketing_email</summary>\\n\\nCreates a new marketing email with promotional fields.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `name` (required): Internal email name\\n\\u2022 `subject` (optional): Email subject line. Defaults to None\\n\\u2022 `htmlBody` (optional): HTML email content. Defaults to None\\n\\u2022 `isTransactional` (optional): Boolean flag. Defaults to false\\n\\u2022 `status` (optional): Email status (e.g., 'scheduled', 'sent'). Defaults to None\\n\\u2022 `discount_code` (optional): Promotional discount code. Defaults to None\\n\\u2022 `expiration` (optional): Expiration date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to None\\n\\u2022 `launch_date` (optional): Product launch date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to None\\n\\u2022 `sale_end_date` (optional): Sale end date in YYYY-MM-DD format. Defaults to None\\n\\u2022 `reward_points` (optional): Loyalty program points (integer). Defaults to None\\n\\u2022 `access_code` (optional): VIP access code. Defaults to None\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Create basic email: `name=\\\"Weekly Newsletter\\\"`\\n- Create promotional email: `name=\\\"Spring Sale\\\", subject=\\\"50% Off!\\\", discount_code=\\\"SPRING50\\\", expiration=\\\"2025-04-30\\\"`\\n- Create loyalty email: `name=\\\"Points Earned\\\", reward_points=500`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds new email to marketing_emails collection with auto-generated UUID.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success object with `success` (boolean), `message` (string), and `email_id` (UUID string).\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>update_marketing_email</summary>\\n\\nUpdates an existing marketing email's specified fields.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `email_id` (required): UUID of email to update\\n\\u2022 `name` (optional): New internal name\\n\\u2022 `subject` (optional): New subject line\\n\\u2022 `htmlBody` (optional): New HTML content\\n\\u2022 `isTransactional` (optional): New transactional flag\\n\\u2022 `status` (optional): New status\\n\\u2022 `discount_code` (optional): New discount code\\n\\u2022 `expiration` (optional): New expiration date\\n\\u2022 `launch_date` (optional): New launch date\\n\\u2022 `sale_end_date` (optional): New sale end date\\n\\u2022 `reward_points` (optional): New reward points value\\n\\u2022 `access_code` (optional): New access code\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Email ID can be obtained from `get_marketing_email_by_id`.\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Update subject: `email_id=\\\"ccf9d6ad-dd24-42c3-8592-f5e2688b36b2\\\", subject=\\\"New Subject\\\"`\\n- Extend expiration: `email_id=\\\"...\\\", expiration=\\\"2025-05-31\\\"`\\n- Change status: `email_id=\\\"...\\\", status=\\\"sent\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates only specified fields in the email object.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success object with `success` (boolean) and `message` (string).\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>delete_marketing_email</summary>\\n\\nDeletes a marketing email permanently.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `email_id` (required): UUID of email to delete\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Email ID must exist. Can be obtained from `get_marketing_email_by_id`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Delete email: `email_id=\\\"ccf9d6ad-dd24-42c3-8592-f5e2688b36b2\\\"`\\n- Remove obsolete campaign: Delete when no longer needed\\n\\n**State Changes:** Removes email completely from marketing_emails collection.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success object with `success` (boolean) and `message` (string).\\n\\n**Warning:** Permanent deletion - cannot be undone.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>clone_marketing_email</summary>\\n\\nClones an existing marketing email to create a duplicate with a new name.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `email_id` (required): UUID of email to clone\\n\\u2022 `name` (required): Name for the new cloned email\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Source email ID can be obtained from `get_marketing_email_by_id`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Clone for new campaign: `email_id=\\\"ccf9d6ad-dd24-42c3-8592-f5e2688b36b2\\\", name=\\\"Summer 2025 Version\\\"`\\n- Duplicate template: Clone successful email for reuse with modifications\\n\\n**State Changes:** Creates new email in marketing_emails collection with auto-generated UUID. Copies all fields from source email except id and name.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success object with `email_id` (UUID of cloned email), `success` (boolean), and `message` (string).\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>send_transactional_email</summary>\\n\\nSends a single transactional email (order confirmation, password reset, etc.).\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `message` (required): Message object containing:\\n  - `to` (required): Recipient email address\\n  - `from` (required): Sender email address\\n  - `subject` (required): Email subject line\\n  - `htmlBody` (required): HTML email content\\n  - `cc` (optional): Array of CC email addresses\\n  - `bcc` (optional): Array of BCC email addresses\\n  - `replyTo` (optional): Reply-to email address\\n\\u2022 `customProperties` (optional): Object with custom key-value pairs for personalization\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Send order confirmation: `message={to=\\\"customer@gmail.com\\\", from=\\\"support@gmail.com\\\", subject=\\\"Order Confirmation\\\", htmlBody=\\\"<p>Your order #12345 is confirmed</p>\\\"}, customProperties={order_id=12345}`\\n- Send password reset: `message={to=\\\"user@gmail.com\\\", from=\\\"support@gmail.com\\\", subject=\\\"Password Reset\\\", htmlBody=\\\"<p>Click here to reset...</p>\\\"}`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Creates new email record in transactional_emails collection with auto-generated UUID. Email is stored in array format keyed by UUID. Status is always set to 'sent'.\\n\\n**Returns:** Success object with `success` (boolean), `message` (string description), and `email_id` (UUID string).\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>send_single_email_with_template</summary>\\n\\nSends a single email based on a pre-existing template with personalization.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `template_id` (required): Numeric ID of template to use\\n\\u2022 `message` (required): Message object containing:\\n  - `to` (required): Array of recipient objects with `email` (required) and `name` (optional)\\n  - `cc` (optional): Array of CC recipient objects\\n  - `bcc` (optional): Array of BCC recipient objects\\n  - `from` (optional): Sender object with `email` (required) and `name` (optional)\\n  - `replyTo` (optional): Array of reply-to address objects\\n\\u2022 `customProperties` (optional): Object with custom property values for template substitution (key is property name, value can be string/integer/boolean)\\n\\u2022 `contactProperties` (optional): Object with contact property values for template substitution\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Template ID must exist and be valid. Can be obtained from `get_templates`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Send templated email: `template_id=\\\"296483214\\\", message={to=[{email=\\\"customer@gmail.com\\\", name=\\\"John\\\"}], from={email=\\\"marketing@gmail.com\\\"}}, customProperties={discount_code=\\\"SAVE20\\\"}`\\n- Send with contact props: `template_id=\\\"...\\\", message={...}, contactProperties={firstname=\\\"Jane\\\", company=\\\"Acme\\\"}`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Creates email record using template with variable substitution. Stores in database with template_id and transactional_email_id.\\n\\n**Returns:** Response object with `status` (success/error string), `message` (description), `template_id`, `transactional_email_id` (UUID), and `log` object containing send details.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>create_form_global_event_subscription</summary>\\n\\nCreates a new webhook subscription for global form events. Your webhook endpoint will receive HTTP POST notifications whenever form-related events occur (submissions, updates, deletions).\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `endpoint` (required): Webhook endpoint URL to receive notifications (e.g., \\\"https://example.com/webhook/forms\\\")\\n\\u2022 `subscriptionDetails` (optional): Subscription details object with:\\n  - `contact_id` (optional): Associated contact ID if linking to specific contact\\n  - `subscribed` (optional): Boolean indicating subscription status\\n  - `opt_in_date` (optional): ISO 8601 timestamp when contact opted in\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Create basic webhook: `endpoint=\\\"https://example.com/webhook/forms\\\"`\\n- Create with contact tracking: `endpoint=\\\"https://...\\\", subscriptionDetails={contact_id=\\\"cf9e6433...\\\", subscribed=true, opt_in_date=\\\"2024-01-15T10:30:00\\\"}`\\n- Set up notification endpoint: Provide your server URL that can handle POST requests with form event data\\n\\n**State Changes:** Adds new subscription to subscriptions collection with auto-generated UUID. Automatically sets active=true and adds subscription_id to subscriptionDetails.\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete subscription object including generated UUID, endpoint, subscriptionDetails with subscription_id added, and active=true.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>update_form_global_event_subscription</summary>\\n\\nUpdates a webhook subscription to activate or deactivate it. Use this to temporarily pause notifications without deleting the subscription configuration.\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `subscriptionId` (required): UUID of subscription to update (must be non-empty string)\\n\\u2022 `active` (required): Boolean - true to enable notifications, false to pause them\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Subscription ID must exist. Can be obtained from `get_form_global_event_subscriptions`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Pause webhook notifications: `subscriptionId=\\\"35dd4e8d-c209-4f4c-b0b2-1af31dfa5a3c\\\", active=false`\\n- Resume paused webhook: `subscriptionId=\\\"...\\\", active=true`\\n- Temporarily disable during maintenance: Set active=false, then reactivate when ready\\n\\n**State Changes:** Updates only the `active` field of the subscription. Endpoint and subscriptionDetails remain unchanged.\\n\\n**Returns:** Complete updated subscription object with new active status.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n<details class=\\\"tool\\\">\\n<summary>delete_form_global_event_subscription</summary>\\n\\nDeletes (unsubscribes) a webhook subscription permanently. Use this to completely remove a webhook configuration, for example when a webhook URL is no longer valid or accessible\\n\\n**Parameters:**\\n\\u2022 `subscriptionId` (required): UUID of subscription to delete (must be non-empty string that exists in database)\\n\\n**Prerequisites:** Subscription ID must exist. Can be obtained from `get_form_global_event_subscriptions`.\\n\\n**Usage Examples:**\\n- Remove webhook subscription: `subscriptionId=\\\"35dd4e8d-c209-4f4c-b0b2-1af31dfa5a3c\\\"`\\n\\n**State Changes:** Removes subscription completely from subscriptions collection. Endpoint will no longer receive any form event notifications.\\n\\n**Returns:** `None`\\n\\n**Warning:** Permanent deletion - cannot be undone. If you only need to temporarily pause notifications, use `update_form_global_event_subscription` with active=false instead.\\n\\n</details>\\n\\n</details>\\n\"}", "html_preview_b_db": "the initial Produced by Bill Drummond and Jimmy Cauty.</p>\\n<h3>Cultural Context</h3>\\n<p>A landmark track of the UK Acid House and Rave movement. famously deleted from their back catalog in 1992.</p>\\n<p><strong>Strategic Connection (The Orb):</strong> There is a direct lineage between this track and <em>Little Fluffy Clouds</em> via member Jimmy Cauty.</p>\\n<p><strong>Influenced Artists:</strong> The KLF's use of cinematic samples directly influenced the work of <strong>The Future Sound of London</strong>, specifically their breakout track <strong>\\\"Papua New Guinea\\\"</strong>.</p>\\n<h3>Marketing Potential</h3>\\n<p>Unmatched for \\\"Retro-Futurism\\\" branding.</p>\", \"representation\": \"storage\"}}, \"version\": {\"number\": 2, \"minorEdit\": false}, \"history\": {\"latest\": true, \"createdBy\": {\"type\": \"known\", \"username\": \"system\", \"displayName\": \"System User\"}, \"createdDate\": \"2025-12-22T15:00:00.000Z\"}, \"link\": \"/wiki/rest/api/content/9\"}, \"10\": {\"id\": \"10\", \"type\": \"page\", \"title\": \"NMR: The KLF - Justified and Ancient\", \"spaceKey\": \"NMR\", \"status\": \"current\", \"body\": {\"storage\": {\"value\": \"<h2>New Music Research Report</h2>\\n<p><strong>Song Title:</strong> Justified & Ancient (Stand by The JAMs)</p>\\n<p><strong>Artist:</strong> The KLF featuring Tammy Wynette</p>\\n<hr />\\n<h3>Background & History</h3>\\n<p>Released in 1991, this version of the track is a collaborative effort between the KLF and American country music legend Tammy Wynette. It reached #2 in the UK and #11 in the US. The song is famous for its surrealist lyrics about \\\"Mu Mu Land\\\" and its unlikely stylistic blend of dance-pop and country.</p>\\n<h3>Cultural Context</h3>\\n<p>A prime example of the KLF's \\\"pop as performance art\\\" approach. The collaboration with Wynette was seen as a bold cross-genre experiment that bridged the gap between the Nashville establishment and the British rave scene. It remains one of the most recognizable tracks of the early 90s.</p>\\n<h3>Marketing Potential</h3>\\n<p>Excellent for \\\"Unexpected Collaboration\\\" or \\\"Genre-Bending\\\" themed campaigns.
