           contentArea.innerHTML = `&lt;div id=&quot;root&quot;&gt;Loading ${data.componentName}...&lt;/div&gt;`;\n                currentScript = document.createElement(&#x27;script&#x27;);\n                currentScript.src = finalUrl;\n                currentScript.onerror = () =&gt; { contentArea.innerHTML = `&lt;div style=&quot;padding:20px;color:#d93025;&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Error:&lt;/b&gt; Failed to load script.&lt;br&gt;${finalUrl}&lt;/div&gt;`; };\n                document.body.appendChild(currentScript);\n            }\n\n            function renderJson(index) {\n                if (currentScript) currentScript.remove();\n                const canDiff = currentJsonDataPrev !== null;\n                const diffToggleHtml = canDiff ? `&lt;label class=&quot;toggle-wrapper&quot; title=&quot;Show diff from previous state&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;toggle-switch&quot;&gt;&lt;input type=&quot;checkbox&quot; id=&quot;diffToggle&quot; ${showDiffView ? &#x27;checked&#x27; : &#x27;&#x27;} onchange=&quot;toggleDiffView(this.checked)&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;slider&quot;&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Show Diff&lt;/label&gt;` : &#x27;&#x27;;\n                contentArea.innerHTML = `\n                    &lt;div class=&quot;json-container&quot; id=&quot;json-container&quot;&gt;\n                        &lt;div class=&quot;json-toolbar&quot;&gt;\n                            &lt;div class=&quot;json-search-controls&quot; id=&quot;json-search-controls&quot;&gt;\n                                &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; id=&quot;jsonSearch&quot; class=&quot;json-search&quot; placeholder=&quot;Filter JSON...&quot; oninput=&quot;handleJsonFilter()&quot;&gt;\n                                &lt;label class=&quot;toggle-wrapper&quot; title=&quot;Smart Filter&quot;&gt;&lt;div class=&quot;toggle-switch&quot;&gt;&lt;input type=&quot;checkbox&quot; id=&quot;smartFilterToggle&quot; ${smartFilterEnabled ? &#x27;checked&#x27; : &#x27;&#x27;} onchange=&quot;toggleSmartFilter(this.checked)&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;slider&quot;&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;Smart Filter&lt;/label&gt;\n                            &lt;/div&gt;\n                            ${diffToggleHtml}\n                        &lt;/div&gt;\n                        &lt;pre class=&quot;json-scroll-area&quot;       toggleDiffView(showDiffView &amp;&amp; canDiff);\n            }\n\n            function toggleDiffView(isDiff) {\n                showDiffView = isDiff;\n                const container = document.getElementById(&#x27;json-container&#x27;); if (!container) return;\n                if (isDiff) {\n                    container.classList.add(&#x27;diff-active&#x27;);\n style=&quot;padding:16px;color:#098658;font-style:italic;&quot;&gt;// No changes detected.&lt;/div&gt;&#x27;; }\n                } else {\n                    container.classList.remove(&#x27;diff-active&#x27;);\n                    handleJsonFilter();\n                }\n            }\n            function updateActiveRowState() { menuRows.forEach((row, i) =&gt; { row.classList.remove(&#x27;active&#x27;, &#x27;active-json&#x27;, &#x27;docs-open&#x27;); if (i === currentIndex) { row.classList.add(currentMode === &#x27;preview&#x27; ? &#x27;active&#x27; : &#x27;active-json&#x27;); if (docsOpen) row.classList.add(&#x27;docs-open&#x27;); } }); }\n            function updateDocsPanelState() { if (docsOpen) { docsPanel.classList.add(&#x27;open&#x27;); docsResizer.style.display = &#x27;block&#x27;; } else { docsPanel.classList.remove(&#x27;open&#x27;); docsResizer.style.display = &#x27;none&#x27;; } updateActiveRowState(); }\n            function toggleSmartFilter(checked) { smartFilterEnabled = checked; handleJsonFilter(); }\n            function handleJsonFilter() {\n                const term = document.getElementById(&#x27;jsonSearch&#x27;)?.value.toLowerCase(); const output = document.getElementById(&#x27;jsonOutput&#x27;); if (!output) return;\n                if (!term) { output.innerHTML = syntaxHighlight(currentJsonData); return; }\n                const filtered = smartFilter(currentJsonData, term, smartFilterEnabled);\n                output.innerHTML = (filtered === undefined) ? &#x27;&lt;span style=&quot;color:#7f848e; font-style:italic;&quot;&gt;// No matches found&lt;/span&gt;&#x27; : syntaxHighlight(filtered);\n            }\n            function smartFilter(obj, term, useSmartMode) {\n                if (typeof obj !== &#x27;object&#x27; || obj === null) return String(obj).toLowerCase().includes(term) ? obj : undefined;\n                if (Array.isArray(obj)) { const f = obj.map(i =&gt; smartFilter(i, term, useSmartMode)).filter(x =&gt; x !== undefined); return f.length &gt; 0 ? f : undefined; }\n                let res = {}, has = false, child = false;\n                for (const [k, v] of Object.entries(obj)) { if (k.toLowerCase().includes(term)) { res[k] = v; has = true; continue; } const fv = smartFilter(v, term, useSmartMode); if (fv !== undefined) { has = true; child = true; res[k] = fv; } }\n                if (useSmartMode &amp;&amp; child &amp;&amp; (obj.id || obj.threadId || obj.emailAddress || obj.resourceName || obj.alarm_id || obj.timer_id)) return obj;\n                return has ? res : undefined;\n            }\n            function syntaxHighlight(json) {\n                if (json === null || json === undefined) return &#x27;&lt;span class=&quot;j-null&quot;&gt;null&lt;/span&gt;&#x27;;\n                if (typeof json !== &#x27;string&#x27;) json = JSON.stringify(json, undefined, 2);\n                return json.replace(/&amp;/g, &#x27;&amp;amp;&#x27;).replace(/&lt;/g, &#x27;&amp;lt;&#x27;).replace(/&gt;/g, &#x27;&amp;gt;&#x27;).replace(/(&quot;(\\u[a-zA-Z0-9]{4}|\\[^u]|[^\\&quot;])*&quot;(\\s*:)?|\b(true|false|null)\b|-?\\d+(?:\\d*)?(?:[eE][+\\-]?\\d+)?)/g, m =&gt; {\n                    let c = &#x27;j-number&#x27;; if (/^&quot;/.test(m)) c = /:$/.test(m) ? &#x27;j-key&#x27; : &#x27;j-string&#x27;; else if (/true|false/.test(m)) c = &#x27;j-boolean&#x27;; else if (/null/.test(m)) c = &#x27;j-null&#x27;; return &#x27;&lt;span class=&quot;&#x27; + c + &#x27;&quot;&gt;&#x27; + m + &#x27;&lt;/span&gt;&#x27;; });\n            }\n            if (pageContents.length &gt; 0) Hopefully, that will pull up the entry, even if it's got a slightly altered title, part of a compilation album, or just miscategorized in some way. It\u2019s a good starting point to eliminate the more obvious problems with the search terms themselves. Let's see if we can get anything that way, and then we can refine from there if it yields results.\n\n\n\n\n</details>\n\n<details>\n<summary>[MODEL (Calling Tool: spotify.search_for_item)]</summary>\n\n```json\n{\n  \"q\": \"Papua New Guinea\",\n  \"type\": \"track\"\n}\n```\n\n</details>\n\n\n<br>==================== STEP 9: FUNCTION ====================\n\n<details>\n<summary>[TOOL RESULT for search_for_item]</summary>\n\n```json\n{\n  \"success\": true,\n  \"result\": {\n    \"tracks\": {\n      \"items\": [],\n      \"total\": 0,\n      \"limit\": 20,\n      \"offset\": 0,\n      \"href\": \"https://api.spotify.com/v1/search?q=Papua New Guinea&type=track\",\n      \"next\": null,\n      \"previous\": null\n    }\n  },\n  \"error\": null\n}\n```\n\n</details>\n\n\n<br>==================== STEP 10: MODEL ====================\n\n<details>\n<summary>[MODEL (Thinking)] Navigating a Spotify Music Search</summary>\n\n**Navigating a Spotify Music Search**\n\nOkay, so I've hit a wall here. I've tried three different searches on Spotify for \"Papua New Guinea,\" and I'm coming up empty every time. First, I went with `track:Papua New Guinea artist:The Future Sound of London`. Then, I tried `The Future Sound of London Papua New Guinea`. Finally, just `Papua New Guinea` on its own. Nothing. I double-checked the spelling, and it looks good.\n\nI was tempted to try searching directly for \"The Future Sound of London\" to see their tracks, but the protocol is pretty clear about the three-distinct-queries rule, and I'm counting \"Papua New Guinea\" as the entity here. I even took another look at the original search results, and still, zero results across the board. Strange for such a well-known track. I did consider that the user's Spotify might have restrictions, or maybe the track just isn't available, but the instructions are pretty clear: if I can't find it, stop!\n\nI quickly glanced back at the recent playlist results I had gathered earlier. Those seemed fine. But that doesn't help me with this task.\n\nI was tempted to search Confluence to confirm the track and artist, but that is not the goal. The task is to find a track and add it to a playlist.\n\nI even had a moment of doubt, wondering if the report was referring to \"3am Eternal\" instead, but I know that's the title of the report, not the track.\n\nSo, I'm going to have to stop here. Produced by Bill Drummond and Jimmy Cauty.</p>\\n<h3>Cultural Context</h3>\\n<p>A landmark track of the UK Acid House and Rave movement. famously deleted from their back catalog in 1992.</p>\\n<p><strong>Strategic Connection (The Orb):</strong> There is a direct lineage between this track and <em>Little Fluffy Clouds</em> via member Jimmy Cauty.</p>\\n<p><strong>Influenced Artists:</strong> The KLF's use of cinematic samples directly influenced the work of <strong>The Future Sound of London</strong>, specifically their breakout track <strong>\\\"Papua New Guinea\\\"</strong>.</p>\\n<h3>Marketing Potential</h3>\\n<p>Unmatched for \\\"Retro-Futurism\\\" branding.</p>\", \"representation\": \"storage\"}}, \"version\": {\"number\": 2, \"minorEdit\": false}, \"history\": {\"latest\": true, \"createdBy\": {\"type\": \"known\", \"username\": \"system\", \"displayName\": \"System User\"}, \"createdDate\": \"2025-12-22T15:00:00.000Z\"}, \"link\": \"/wiki/rest/api/content/9\"}, \"10\": {\"id\": \"10\", \"type\": \"page\", \"title\": \"NMR: The KLF - Justified and Ancient\", \"spaceKey\": \"NMR\", \"status\": \"current\", \"body\": {\"storage\": {\"value\": \"<h2>New Music Research Report</h2>\\n<p><strong>Song Title:</strong> Justified & Ancient (Stand by The JAMs)</p>\\n<p><strong>Artist:</strong> The KLF featuring Tammy Wynette</p>\\n<hr />\\n<h3>Background & History</h3>\\n<p>Released in 1991, this version of the track is a collaborative effort between the KLF and American country music legend Tammy Wynette. It reached #2 in the UK and #11 in the US. The song is famous for its surrealist lyrics about \\\"Mu Mu Land\\\" and its unlikely stylistic blend of dance-pop and country.</p>\\n<h3>Cultural Context</h3>\\n<p>A prime example of the KLF's \\\"pop as performance art\\\" approach. The collaboration with Wynette was seen as a bold cross-genre experiment that bridged the gap between the Nashville establishment and the British rave scene. It remains one of the most recognizable tracks of the early 90s.</p>\\n<h3>Marketing Potential</h3>\\n<p>Excellent for \\\"Unexpected Collaboration\\\" or \\\"Genre-Bending\\\" themed campaigns. Produced by Bill Drummond and Jimmy Cauty.</p>\\n<h3>Cultural Context</h3>\\n<p>A landmark track of the UK Acid House and Rave movement. famously deleted from their back catalog in 1992.</p>\\n<p><strong>Strategic Connection (The Orb):</strong> There is a direct lineage between this track and <em>Little Fluffy Clouds</em> via member Jimmy Cauty.</p>\\n<p><strong>Influenced Artists:</strong> The KLF's use of cinematic samples directly influenced the work of <strong>The Future Sound of London</strong>, specifically their breakout track <strong>\\\"Papua New Guinea\\\"</strong>.</p>\\n<h3>Marketing Potential</h3>\\n<p>Unmatched for \\\"Retro-Futurism\\\" branding.</p>\", \"representation\": \"storage\"}}, \"version\": {\"number\": 2, \"minorEdit\": false}, \"history\": {\"latest\": true, \"createdBy\": {\"type\": \"known\", \"username\": \"system\", \"displayName\": \"System User\"}, \"createdDate\": \"2025-12-22T15:00:00.000Z\"}, \"link\": \"/wiki/rest/api/content/9\"}, \"10\": {\"id\": \"10\", \"type\": \"page\", \"title\": \"NMR: The KLF - Justified and Ancient\", \"spaceKey\": \"NMR\", \"status\": \"current\", \"body\": {\"storage\": {\"value\": \"<h2>New Music Research Report</h2>\\n<p><strong>Song Title:</strong> Justified & Ancient (Stand by The JAMs)</p>\\n<p><strong>Artist:</strong> The KLF featuring Tammy Wynette</p>\\n<hr />\\n<h3>Background & History</h3>\\n<p>Released in 1991, this version of the track is a collaborative effort between the KLF and American country music legend Tammy Wynette. It reached #2 in the UK and #11 in the US. The song is famous for its surrealist lyrics about \\\"Mu Mu Land\\\" and its unlikely stylistic blend of dance-pop and country.</p>\\n<h3>Cultural Context</h3>\\n<p>A prime example of the KLF's \\\"pop as performance art\\\" approach. It reached #2 in the UK and #11 in the US. The song is famous for its surrealist lyrics about \\\"Mu Mu Land\\\" and its unlikely stylistic blend of dance-pop and country.</p>\\n<h3>Cultural Context</h3>\\n<p>A prime example of the KLF's \\\"pop as performance art\\\" approach. The collaboration with Wynette was seen as a bold cross-genre experiment that bridged the gap between the Nashville establishment and the British rave scene. It remains one of the most recognizable tracks of the early 90s.</p>\\n<h3>Marketing Potential</h3>\\n<p>Excellent for \\\"Unexpected Collaboration\\\" or \\\"Genre-Bending\\\" themed campaigns.
